loans.name: Sina

texts.en: Sina S. is a 39-year-old woman living in the town of Fasitoo Uta. She is married and has five school-aged children. Sina owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 350 WST a month. In 2008, Sina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Sina is now requesting a new loan of 1,500 WST which will again be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. The loan will be her 2nd from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. Sina is not affected by the tsunami which hit Samoa on 29th September 2009. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Vaifoa

texts.en:
Vaifoa P. is a 38 -year-old woman.  She lives in the town of Faleasiu.  She is married and has 5 school-aged children.  To make a living, Vaifoa owns & operates a business in the agriculture sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting bananas for sale.  Vaifoa has been engaged in this business for over 4 years.  From these activities, Vaifoa earns approximately $500 WST a month.

In 2008, Vaifoa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Vaifoa is requesting a loan from SPBD.  A previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  She is now requesting a new loan of $1500 WST.  The current loan will be used to purchase harvesting equipment. The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Varifoa from SPBD.  Vaifoa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

Vaifoa is not affected by the tsunami which hit Samoa on 9/29/09. 

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Sina S. is a 35-year-old woman living in the town of Faleasiu.  She is married and has 4 school-aged children.  To make a living, Sina owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Sina has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately $550 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Sina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Sina has successfully repaid a previous loan of $1000 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  Sina is now requesting a new loan of $1500 WST which will again be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Sina plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.

Sina is not affected by the tsunami which hit Samoa on 9/29/09. 

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Kiganda Nanono Prosy Group

texts.en:
N. Prosy is thirty-five years old and a business lady representing her loan group. She is married with three school aged children. She deals in the hardware business, selling charcoal stoves, sauce pans, metallic boxes, etc and she has been in this business for over ten years. 

Nanonois plans on using the loan to purchase supplies of hard ware items to generate increased profits for her business. She is a hardworking business woman, cheerful and encouraging. Her dream is to purchase a plot of land and construct a house.

loans.use: To purchase supplies of hardware items to earn more profits in her business.

loans.name: Kiganda 3 Namunga Sarah Group

texts.en: N. Sarah is the president of her group. She is 33 years old and blessed with nine children, seven of whom are in school. She also has two dependents in school. For over seven years, Sarah has been operating a butcher's business, selling pork. She is using her loan to purchase and sell pork to her customers. Sarah is a hardworking businesswoman whose goal is to improve her business and offer good quality pork joints. She also dreams of purchasing a plot of land to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase pork to sell

loans.name: Kiganda 3 Nanyunja Regina Group

texts.en:
N. Regina is twenty-nine years old, is single, and is blessed with three children, all schooling.

Regina operates a restaurant business and, so far, she has stayed in her business for one year. She is using the loan to purchase restaurant items such as food (cassava, Irish and sweet potatoes), drinks (sodas, juices, and Splash - a commercial fruit juice) and other foods.

Regina is hardworking and is encouraged to educate her children and at least to get her own plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase items for her restaurant

loans.name: Kiganda 3 Atukuda Scovia Group

texts.en: A. Scovia is twenty-nine years old and a single mother. She is blessed with two children and cares for  one dependent child . All are attending school. She has operated a pub business for the past two years. She is requesting a loan to purchase pub items such as chairs, umbrellas, beer, etc so that she will be able to attract more customers.  A.'s small pub which can not accommodate all of her customers, so she wants to extend the place by use of chairs and umbrellas. She is a promising business lady, hardworking, whose dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase pub items such as chairs, umbrellas, beer, etc so that she can attract more customers.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita B. is a 54-year-old married woman. She has 4 children and the eldest is 24 years old. Her business is rice farming, which is the main source of her income. She works hard on her farm because she says it is very helpful to her family income. Rosita applied for a loan of Php10, 000 from CEVI to finance her farm. She will use this loan to purchase the necessary fertilizers, and other farm needs.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is a farmer from Agusan Del Sur. She plants rice on her farm. She is 55 years old, married, and has 8 children. Her farming business helps her family expenses and also supports her children’s education. She wants to expand her farm so she could help improve her family’s living condition. Lydia applied for a loan from CEVI for Php12, 000. She will use this loan to finance her farm and hopefully expanding her business.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin takes good care of her rice field. A 45-year-old married farmer, she has now four children with the eldest being 26 years old.

For Jasmin, her farming business is very important because it gives her family food to eat and also supports her children’s education. To support her farming, she requested to loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. This loan will be used to purchase fertilizer and other inputs that Jasmin’s farm needs.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
44-year-old Genelyn B. is a rice farmer. She takes care of her eight children.

Genelyn experienced difficulty when her rice field got flooded and it was a big problem for her whole family. But she is thankful to God she was able to get through it and move on.

Genelyn is also grateful she became a member of CEVI because she can now borrow money at the low interest rate of 2% per month. Now she is requesting to loan of Php 12,000 which she will use to acquire farm inputs needed at her farm.

loans.use: To use for farm financing

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John W. is a happily married father of two. After learning how to repair vehicles, he started his own garage in the outskirts of town. He wanted to become an entrepreneur so that he could take care of his family and siblings. 

He has been in this business for over seven years now and has hired three staff members on a casual basis. From the income earned from this business, he has managed to open a spare parts shop, which is currently run by his wife. Competition and price undercutting in the area has been a great challenge for his business. Consequently, he is requesting for kshs. 80,000, which he will use to purchase more spare parts.

loans.use: purchasing more spare parts

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony K. is married and the happy father of a 3 year old boy. He started his engineering and fabrication business 2 years ago. Unfortunately, last year he lost his only compressor machine for constructing roads as a result of fire. The cause of the fire was as result of business rivalry. Thereafter, he decided to concentrate on welding and metal work. His clients consist mainly of construction companies and schools, among others; for them, he presses metals and does engineering work. He has employed three staff members on a casual basis.

He is requesting a loan of kshs. 20,000 in order to purchase brass. Brass is a metal that is heavily used especially during this time of booming business.

loans.use: purchasing brass, which aids in drilling

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice N. is 46 years old and is a widow with two children aged 24 and 30. She lives in Kicukiro district in Kigali, the capital of Rwanda.

Beatrice has been an entrepreneur for some time now, starting her business in 2005. Her popular shop employs three people. She has a lot of experience in decoration activities. Her store is open from 9 a.m. - 7 p.m. each day.

This is Beatrice’s first loan with Vision Finance Company. This loan will allow her to purchase more inventory and different types of decorations for sale and for rent which will help her to attract more customers and, hopefully, more profits.

Beatrice currently hopes to make monthly profits of over 100,000 RWF (approximately USD 175). She wants to build her business to give herself a secure future in her old age.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory and different types of decorations for sale and rent

loans.name: Jerome

texts.en:
Jerome S. is 36 years old and is married with three children. He lives in Nyarugenge district of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Jerome has had a shop selling jewelry since 1998 and is well known in his area as an entrepreneur. His business has succeeded for over ten years. The hours of his business are from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day.

Jerome is requesting his first loan from Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding his business. He will use the loan to buy a variety of different types of jewelry at different price points for different customer types. This, he believes, will attract more customers.

With this loan, Jerome is hopeful for the prospects of his business venture. He hopes to set aside some funds to make his family's future more secure.

loans.use: To buy more types of jewelry at different price points

loans.name: C4349 Dufatanye Group

texts.en:
Dinah N. is 45 years old and is married with one child aged 27. She also cares for one dependent who is three years old.

An upstanding member in her community, N. has been the president of a group called Dufatanye since 2005. Dufatanye operates its business of selling a wide variety of clothes for all types and sizes from 7 a.m. to 4 p.m. every day. They employ four people in their business which has been in operation since 2005.

The group is requesting their first loan from Vision Finance Company and Kiva lenders for the purpose of expanding their business. They will use the loan to purchase more variety, sizes and popular clothes for sale. With this loan, they hope that their lives will change progressively as they can make more money through their efforts and set aside some savings for the future.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline M. is 31 years old and is married with two children aged between 9 and 2 years. She lives in Nyakabanda sector in the Nyarugenge district of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Jacqueline has had a shop selling mixed shoes for a period of three months. Her very new business is open from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Jacqueline is a true entrepreneur and very hopeful for her future success.  She is requesting a loan from Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing more shoes for sale as well as by providing a needed working-capital cushion.

With the profits from her expanded business, Jacqueline hopes to improve her life situation and support her family.

loans.use: To buy more variety of shoes

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly M. is 34 years old and is married with three children aged between 3 and 9 years. She lives in Nyarugenge district of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Nelly has had a dispensary since 2007. She operates 24 hours every day, serving her community’s health needs and emergencies. She employs three nurses in her dispensary.

Nelly is now requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company and Kiva for the purpose of renewing and updating some rooms of her dispensary. This, in turn, will make her dispensary more effective and modern as well as more attractive. By this method, she hopes that her dispensary will grow through adding some other new medical services and serving additional clients as well.

loans.use: To renew and update her dispensary rooms

loans.name: Antoine

texts.en:
Antoine U. is 30 years old, is married with one child, and he takes care of five dependents. He lives in Nyarugenge district of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda where he has had shop selling fabric and making/sewing clothes since 2002. His business is open from 8 AM to 8 PM every day and, in that business, he employs two people.

Antoine is now requesting his first loan from Vision Finance Company for the purpose of purchasing some new types of clothes and fabrics which he believes his customers will appreciate. With this loan, he hopes to be able to attract more customers and strengthen his business which will help him to build a secure future for his family and dependents.  He is grateful to VFC and Kiva lenders for facilitating his credit needs.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of fabrics and clothes

loans.name: Christian

texts.en:
Christian is 26 years old and single but he has three dependents that he cares for aged 10, 12 and 15.

Christian’s shop is relatively new - only 7 months old, but so far the business is doing quite well. He employs two other people as helpers in his store. He works long days and is trying to establish his business as a leading provider of general and sundry merchandise in his community.

This is Christian’s first loan from Vision Finance Company and Kiva lenders and he hopes to use the proceeds to help his cash flow and working capital situation. He will also use the loan to buy new items for this shop that he thinks his customers will want to purchase. At the same time, by purchasing in larger quantities he will be able to garner lower prices for his products which will give him more profit at the end of the day.

Christian wants this business to succeed to provide a secure future for himself and his dependents.

loans.use: To help his cash flow and working capital situation and to buy new items for this shop

loans.name: Abel

texts.es: Abel es casado, tiene una niña de una año, de profesion Ingeniero Civil, habitante de la de zona 4 de Nueva Guinea, solicita su primer crèdito a AFODENIC y espera ser beneficiado por  el fondo Kiva para comprar una computadora, necesita obtener su propio equipo de trabajo para fortaler sus labores diaria pues indispensable para poder cumplir con sus compromisos, él  labora en la Alcaldía municipal desempeñandose como consultor de diseños y presupuesto de construcciòn en general, Abel es un joven de buenos principios religiosos, de familia reconocida, honesta, y muy querido en la comunidad.
texts.en:
Abel is married and has a one year old daughter. He is a civil engineer, and he lives in Zona 4 in New Guinea. He is asking AFODENIC for his first loan. He hopes to benefit from Kiva funds to buy a computer. He needs to obtain he own work equipment in order to strengthen his daily work. It is indispensable to be able to complete his obligations. He works on the general construction budget and as a design consultant at the municipal town hall. Abel is a young man with good religious principals, is from a well known family, is honest, and is very loved in his community.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a computer

loans.name: Matenkay Group

texts.en:
These are the members of the Matenkay group. They are small scale businesswomen in the town of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of Le 500,000 for each; this money will enable them improve their businesses. For instance, they will be able to add more goods into their stalls and thus make more sales and increased profits. Consequently, their living standard will improve so that they can better look after themselves and children. 

The leader of this group is Ramatu C. (left). Ramatu was born in Matotoka village, about eight miles from Magburaka town. She is now thirty seven years old. She is married to a teacher and they have three children – one in secondary school and two in primary schools. Ramatu sells palm-oil and sometimes rice. She has been a businesswoman for six years now.

loans.use: investing in their businesses

loans.name: Conteh United Group

texts.en:
The people pictured here are Obai C., Amasu C. and Saphie K.. They are local entrepreneurs in Magburaka town. They named their group C. United. This is the first loan for which these entrepreneurs are applying. With the help of this loan, they will be able to make enough profit to feed their children, pay their school fees, and save some money for unforeseen situations. 

Obai C. (on the right) is the leader of the group. Obai is forty years of age. He is married to a businesswoman and they have three children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Obai sells medicines. He has been in the business for three years now. He will use this loan to buy more drugs to add to his drug store.

loans.use: purchasing more drugs for his drugstore

loans.name: María Alejandrina

texts.es:
María es madre soltera, es madre de un bebé de 6 meses de nacido y vive junto a sus padres y su abuelita en el Anexo San Sebastián, perteneciente al Centro Poblado Romero, distrito de Mórrope, ubicado a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella es propietaria de una bodega que funciona en su casa y con ella trata de solventar sus gastos y de apoyar al sostenimiento económico de su familia. Actualmente viaja una vez por semana a la ciudad de Chiclayo a comprar su mercadería y con mucho esfuerzo esta sacando adelante a su negocio.

La continua demanda de los vecinos de su zona y de otros caseríos ha hecho que piense en ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, acite), abarrotes y bebidas (gaseosas y cerveza), por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

María piensa en seguir creciendo con su negocio y seguir abasteciendo a los pobladores de su zona y de las zonas colindantes, ella es una mujer luchadora y siempre trata de sacar adelante a los suyos.
texts.en:
María is a single mother; she has a six month old baby. She lives with her parents and her grandmother in the Anexo San Sebastián, which belongs to the Centro Poblado Romero in the Mórrope district. It is located 40 from the city of Chiclayo. She has a convenience store, which is in her house. With the store she tries to pay her expenses and to help the family economically. Currently she travels once a week to the city of Chiclayo to buy merchandise. With great effort she is getting ahead in her business. The continual demand from her neighbors in the area and other villages has made her think about expanding her business. She would do this by purchasing more basic needs type products (rice, sugar, oil), groceries, and drinks (soft drinks and beer). That is why she is asking Edpyme Alternativea, for the first time, for a loan for 1,000 PEN. María intends to keep growing with her business and to keep serving the people in her area and in adjacent areas. She is a woman who is a fighter, and she always tries to get her loved ones ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to increase her business

location.town: Anexo San Sebastián - Centro Poblado Romero - Morr

loans.name: Bless Smt Group

texts.en:
This picture is of Isatu K., Isatu F., Fatmata K. and Rugie K.. They call their group Bless SMT, in recognition of the good work that SMT (Salone Micro Finance Trust) has done. These women are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva for the first time to seek a loan of Le 500,000 to help them develop their businesses. With the help of this loan, their businesses will increase both in size and quality, attracting more customers so that sales will improve and profit will also increase; consequently, their standard of living will improve.

Isatu K. (second from right) is the leader of this group. She is approximately thirty-eight years of age. She is married and has three children. Isatu’s husband is retired and her children are attending schools. Two are in primary schools and one is in secondary school. Isatu sells dried fish at the market and sells cooked rice at one of the schools in Magburaka town. Isatu has been a businesswoman since childhood.

loans.use: investing in their businesses

loans.name: Auxiliadora Del Carmen

texts.es: Auxiliadora está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 2do crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (Construcción de una cocina), trabaja como docente de primaria en la escuela Paulino Halsall, vive en la colonia Yolaina  a 15 kilometros de Nueva Guinea donde la población cada dia crece mas, tiene 2 hijos , la niña mayor de 6 añitos estudia 2do año de educación primaria, la otra hija de Educación primaria y el niño menor de 3 añitos, su esposo trabaja como docente en la misma escuela que ella trabaja, ambos comparte los gastos del hogar y los compromisos adquiridos, su sueño es seguir  estudiando, tener salud y en el futuro tener una casa bonita con todas las condiciones  y tener estabilidad laboral para así ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Auxiliadora is asking to refinance her 2nd loan to invest in improvements for her home (construction on a new kitchen). She works as a primary school teacher at the Paulino Halsall School. She lives in the Yolaina colony, 15 kilometers from New Guinea where the population grows more every day. She has two daughters and two sons: An older son, an older daughter of 6 who is in her 2nd year of primary education, another daughter who in her first year of primary school, and a younger son who is 3. Her husband works as a teacher at the same school where she works. The both share in the household expenses and acquired commitments. Her dream is to continue studying, to have health and in the future to have a nice home with all the amenities, and to have job stability so that she can help her family.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: home construction

loans.name: Mutesayire

texts.en:
S. is 33 years of age with one child and a dependent she takes care of as well. She is married and her husband works as well, earning a decent wage.

S. has been a successful entrepreneur in the clothing and material business for over eight years and earns approximately 100,000 RWF / month (approx. USD 175) for her efforts. She employs two other people as helpers in her enterprise. They all work long hours.

S. has had one loan previously from Vision Finance Company and it is worth noting that it was paid in full and on time. She is a tireless business person with much experience in her field. She hopes to build her business so that it can provide a stable future for her small and growing family, as well as provide needed jobs in her community.

loans.use: To buy new materials for the upcoming season

loans.name: María Rosa

texts.es:
María Rosa es una madre separada de 42 años de edad que vive junto a dos de sus tres hijos en el anexo La Piedra, perteneciente al centro poblado Punto Cuatro, distrito de Mochumí, ubicado a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Lleva vendiendo cerveza y chicha (bebida típica de la región) desde hace 5 años, este negocio sirve para sustentar a su familia, eventualmente su hijo menor trabaja como obrero agrícola, mientras no está estudiando, con lo que también la economía familiar recibe un pequeño apoyo.

Hace algunos día compró una congeladora usada, con la que piensa ampliar su negocio vendiendo bebidas heladas pero aún le falta pagar parte del importe, por lo que se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles que le permitan terminar de pagar su artefacto.

María Rosa sueña con terminar de construir su casa, que está construida en su mayoría de barro y quincha (materiales de construcción muy rústicos), y seguir ampliando las ventas de su negocio. Ella es una madre responsable y que siempre ha luchado por sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is a 42 year old separated mother. She lives with two of her three children in the La Piedra Annex, part of the central community of Punto Cuatro in the district of Mochumí, located 30 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She has been selling beer and chicha (a typical drink of the region) for 5 years. This business supports her family. At times, her younger son will work as an agricultural laborer when he isn’t studying and with what he also earns the family receives a little support.

Some time ago she purchased a used freezer with which she planned to expand her business selling cold drinks. She hasn’t yet paid part of the amount due which is why, for the first time, she is applying for a loan of 700 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa. This will permit her to pay for the equipment.

María Rosa dreams of finishing the construction of her house, which is built mainly with mud and reeds (very rustic construction materials) and of continuing to expand the sales of her business. She is a responsible mother and has always struggled so that her children can get ahead

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paying for a freezer used for the sale of cold drinks

location.town: Anexo La Piedra - Caserío Punto Cuatro - Mochumí -

loans.name: Francine

texts.en:
Francine is 38 years old and is married with three children aged 3, 5 and 7. She also cares for four dependents from another family.  Her husband works as well, making approximately 60,000 RWF (approx. 105 USD) a month.

Francine’s business is a very simple small boutique selling various goods and products. It is really a hole in the wall type of place which makes very good business sense in terms of reducing rent expense! She has been in business for thirteen years and so is very experienced. Francine employs one other person, a helper, in her shop. The hours of operation are 6 a.m. to 7 p.m. daily.

With this loan, Francine plans to try offering a few new products to her existing clientele as well as having a working capital cushion for any unexpected downturn in sales. This is her first Vision Finance Company loan. Any potential profits from this business will go to providing more and better food for her family as well as saving money for a 'rainy day' (there are plenty of those in Rwanda, by the way).

loans.use: To use as business capital and to buy inventory

loans.name: Elieth Del Socorro

texts.es: Elieth es soltera,  trabaja como docente de educación primaria desde hace 3 años, está solicitando su primer credito a AFODENIC para  Terminar de construir  una habitación, se caracteriza por ser resónsable, honesta,  es muy querida por sus compañeros de trabajo y padres de familia, a pesar que ella no se ha casado ayuda a sus padres con los gastos familiares, esta joven sueña por tener un buen porvenir,  estudiar una licenciatura, estabilidad laboral y  formar una familia.
texts.en:
Elieth is single. She has worked as a primary school teacher for three years. She is asking AFODENIC for her first loan to finish construction on her house. She is characterized as being responsible, honest, and much loved by her work colleagues and parents. Even though she is not married, she helps her parents with the family expenses. This young woman dreams of having a good future, studying for a degree, work stability, and forming a family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plaster her house

loans.name: Saidi

texts.en:
Saidi is 38 years old and married with six children with ages ranging from 4 to 13. He and his wife also care for eight dependents from other families. They both work very hard in their general store selling every day from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. and making a modest 70,000 RWF in net monthly profit.

Saidi and his wife hope this loan will help them to buy more products for sale at better prices for their current clients and will hopefully attract new clients as well.

This is not a large loan, relatively speaking, at 200,000 RWF but could make a big difference in the quality of offerings that Saidi and his wife are able to provide to their valued client base. Building the business is building their future security and that of their children and dependents.

Saidi and his wife are very grateful to Vision Finance Company and Kiva lenders for the support of their shop. They say “murakoze!” which is Kinyarwandan for "thank you".

loans.use: To buy new products for their store

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es: Doña Herminia está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 4to crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda , trabaja como docente de Educación primaria en la colonia la Fonseca desde hace 15 años, es madre de 2 hjos, y a pesar que no recibe  ayuda del padre de sus hijos ella ha luchado para que no les falte nada, es una mujer que  se caracteriza por ser humilde en su labor de trabajo,  muy responsable con sus compromisos, su sueño es tener una vivienda con mejores condiciones, estabilidad laboral para así  ayudar a su familia ya que son de escasos recursos económicos y lograr que sus hijos se preparen con una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Herminia is asking for her fourth loan to improve her house. She has worked as an elementary school teacher in the Fonseca district for 15 years. She has two children. In spite of not receiving help from her children’s father, she has fought so that they do not need anything. She is a woman who is characterized as being humble in her work and very responsible with her commitments. Her dream is to have a house in better condition and to have work stability. She wants to help her family because they have scarce economic resources. She wants to prepare her children for a university education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room

loans.name: Maura Del Socorro

texts.es: Maura del Socorro está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 5to crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda, trabaja como docente en la escuela Enmanuel Mongalo y Rubio, tiene 3 hijos la mayor se desempeña como docente, la otra estudia en la Universidad Uraccan y el niño menor que estudia su cuarto grado de educación primaria, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo el cual es un hombre trabajador que apesar de la dura situacion economica siempre esta apoyando a su familia se desempeña como director de un colegio,Maura es una mujer responsable y trabajadora,se siente agradecida con l AFODENIC pues con los créditos anteriores ha mejorado su vivienda, sueña con tener una vivienda con mejores condiciones y trabajo para así sacar a su familia adelante,,
texts.en:
Maura del Socorro is asking for her fifth loan to improve her house. She works as a teacher at the Enmanuel Mongalo y Rubio School. She has three children. The oldest works as a teacher, the other attends the Uraccan University, and the youngest is in the fourth grade. She has her husband’s support. In spite of the hard economic situation, he is a hard-working man who always supports his family. He is the principal of a school. Maura is a hard-working and responsible woman. She is grateful to AFODENIC. With the previous loans she has improved her house. She dreams of having a house in better condition and having work to get her family ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Put in a floor and plaster the house

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: Teodora es casada, tiene un bebe de 2 añitos de edad, su esposo trabaja como taxista en la zona urbana de Nueva Guinea,  y asume los gastos familiares, viven en la colonia san Antonio a 28 kilometros de Nueva Guinea, está solicitando su 7mo crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (construcción de una habitación), trabaja como docente de primaria en la Escuela Diriangen desde hace 7 años,  actualmente Teodora esta estudiando una licenciatura en la Universidad URACAN Recinto Nueva Guinea, su sueño es seguir estudiando, trabajo, salud y poco a poco ir mejorando su vivienda para tener mejor comodidad para que su hijo crezca en un ambiente comodo y agradable.
texts.en:
Teodora is married and has a 2 year old baby. Her husband works as a taxi driver in the urban zone of Nueva Guinea and is responsible for the family’s expenses. They live in San Antonio colony, 28 miles from Nueva Guinea. They are asking for their 7th loan to invest in improving the home (construction of another room). She has currently been working as a primary school teacher for 7 years. Teodora is studying for a degree at the University URACAN campus, Nueva Guinea. Her dream is to continue studying, working and having good health; and little by little to improve her home to have better living conditions so that her child grows in a comfortable and pleasant environment.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: construction of a new room in the home

loans.name: María Nicolasa

texts.es:
María Nicolasa Gaitán F. de 59 años desde 1979 tiene su propio negocio donde fabrica sombreros, canastas, abanicos y alfombras entre otras cosas típicas. Este oficio lo emprendió de sus padres desde su infancia y lo ha trasmitido a sus hijos y nietos quienes le ayudan en el trabajo.

Gaitán tiene siete años de trabajar con Adim e invertirá el crédito en materiales como trenza, cabuya, lana, hilo, nailon etc.
texts.en:
Maria Nicolasa Gaintan F. is 59 years old and has had her own business since 1979 where she makes hats, baskets, fans, and carpets among other common items. This business was begun by her parents in her childhood and has been handed-down to their children and grandchildren who help her with the work.

G. has been working with ADIM (Asociación Alternativa Para el Desarrollo Integral de las Mujeres/ Alternative Association for the Integral Development of Women) and will invest in materials such as braid, twine, wool, yarn, nylon etc.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy braids, twine, wool, yarn and nylon etc.

loans.name: Aurelio

texts.es:
Aurelio es un padre de familia de 39 años de edad que vive con su esposa y con sus tres hijos en Paredones, sector Muy Finca, distrito de Mochumí. Es una zona netamente agrícola ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se ha dedicado principalmente a la agricultura y ganadería desde que era niño, actualmente cría ovejas y cerdos, los que luego vende en el mercado Moshoqueque de Chiclayo. Este negocio es una de las fuentes de financiamiento de su hogar pero no presenta la estabilidad que requiere para sacarlos adelante.

Es por ello que ha recurrido a otra actividad con la cual ha trabajado desde los 18 años: la pesca; durante las temporadas de pesca artesanal viaja junto a sus hermanos hacia la caleta San José para capturar pescado y luego venderlo a los vecinos del lugar. La zona en donde vive es muy alejada del mar por lo que este negocio le resulta muy rentable.

Aurelio está pensando en dedicar aun más tiempo a su negocio de venta de pescado por lo que planea comprar más pescado. Además que venderlo a los vecinos de su sector el desea venderlo en las zonas colindantes. Por este motivo está solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

El es muy trabajador y anteriormente ha trabajado como taxista y además ha estudiado cómo hacer conexiones eléctricas y sanitarias. El siempre está pensando en sacar adelante a su familia por lo que aprovecha cualquier oportunidad de trabajo que se le presente.

Sus más grande anhelo es conseguir una fuente de trabajo que brinde a su familia la estabilidad que necesita para salir adelante. El también sueña con viajar a España  a trabajar y desde ahí sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Aurelio is the 39 year old father of a family who lives with his wife and their 3 children en Paredones, Muy Finca sector, district of Mochumi. It is a purely agricultural area located an hour from the city of Chiclayo. He has been mainly working in agriculture and ranching since childhood. He currently is raising sheep and pigs, which are then sold at the market in Moshoqueque in Chiclayo. This business is one source of income for his home, but does not provide the stability to keep them going. This is why he has turned to another activity which he has worked at for 18 years: fishing. During the fishing season he travels with his brothers to San Jose creek to catch fish and then sell it to his neighbors. The area where he lives is far from the sea so this business is very profitable. Aurelio is thinking about devoting even more time to his fish business and plans to buy more fish. In addition to selling to his neighbors he would like to sell in the surrounding areas. For this reason he is applying for the first time to Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles. He is hardworking and has previously worked as a taxi driver and has always studied how to make electrical connections and bathroom fittings. He is always thinking of ways to support his family and takes advantage of every opportunity presented to him. His greatest dream is to secure a source of work that would provide the stability for his family that they need to succeed. He also dreams of traveling to Spain to work and from there support his family.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

location.town: Sector Paredones - Caserío Muy Finca - Mochumí - L

loans.name: William Edmundo

texts.es: William está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 2do crédito para  Terminar de construir  una habitación, trabaja como docente de educacion primaria desde hace 3 años, a pesar que no tiene hijos ayuda, a su madre con los gastos de la casa, ya que son de  escasos recursos económicos , William es muy responsable, honesto y muy trabajador, se siente agradecido con AFODENIC  ya que con el credito anterior logro componer  su casa que se encuentraba en mal estado,  su sueño es seguir estudiando, salud para su familia y tener estabilidad laboral.
texts.en:
William is seeking refinancing of his second loan to finish construction of a bedroom. William has worked as a primary school teacher for three years, in spite of the fact that he has no children. He helps his mother with household expenses because money is tight.

William is very responsible and hardworking. He is thankful to AFODENIC for the previous loan, which allowed him to fix up his house, which was in bad condition. His dreams are to continue studying, health for his family, and to have steady employment.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a bedroom

loans.name: Las Marichuis Group

texts.es:
El grupo Marichuis está conformado por Estelvina H. A., María Mercado T. y María Auxiliadora A.. Ellas están empezando a trabajar en Adim y esperan seguir para mejorar sus negocios. 

La joven H. A. empezó ayudándole a su abuelita a hacer tortillas y luego se independizo y Mercado T. de 28 años tiene una historia similar ella le ayudaba a una vecina de la cual aprendió el oficio y luego formo su propia tortillería.

La señora A. de 43 años por iniciativas de su nuera empezó a vender sandalias de hule primero solo le ayudaba a ella pero actualmente comercializa independiente este producto.
texts.en:
The Marichuis group is made up of Estelvina H. A., María Mercado T. and María Auxiliadora A.. They are beginning to work with ADIM, and they hope to improve their businesses.

The young Ms. H. A. started out helping her grandmother to make tortillas, and later she started working independently. Ms. Mercado T., who is 28 years old, has a similar story. She helped a neighbor, who taught her, and later she started her own tortilla shop.

Mrs. A., who is 43 years old, started to sell rubber sandals with the help of her daughter in law. At first, she only helped out, but now she independently sells this product.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: Me llamo Francisco Javier González tengo una pequeña familia la cual la forman  mi esposa Francisca Aracely y mis dos pequeños hijos. Hemos pensado con el tiempo la necesidad que se tiene de ampliar la vivienda ya que nuestros hijos van creciendo y van necesitando de su propio espacio, el cual nos llevo a pensar en la construcción de un cuarto mas, es por ello que les solicitamos su apoyo para poder llevar a cabo este proyecto, nosotros somos gente trabajadora, mi esposa y yo trabajamos en un negocio dedicado a la venta de mercería y papelería en este empleo llevamos 5 años y gracias a Dios nos ha ido muy bien hemos podido sacar a delante poco a poco a nuestros hijos en sus estudios y esperamos poder tener un mejor confort en la vivienda con este proyecto.
texts.en:
My name is Francisco Javier González, and I have a small family, made up of my wife Francisca Aracely and my two small children. We have been thinking about the necessity of expanding our home since our children are growing and need their own space. That made us think about building another room, which is why we are asking for your support to complete this project. We are hard-working people. My wife and I work in a business dedicated to the sale of sewing notions and stationery. We have been doing this for 5 years, and thanks to God it has gone very well. We have been able to help our children move forward in their studies little by little, and we hope to have a more comfortable home with this project.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a room

loans.name: Las Azucenas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Azucenas consta de cinco integrantes trabajadores y con iniciativa. Una de ellas es María del Socorro U. C. de 22 años quien comenzó vendiendo tortillas y enchiladas,  actualmente vende carne.

Alba Lidia G. G. de 24 años tiene dos años de vender comida en la zona franca de Masaya, Consuelo G. de 52 años vende tortilla  y Fátima del Carmen Vichez tiene una pequeña fritanga, un restaurante popular por excelencia en Nicaragua. Este consiste en la venta de alimentos fritos, que están preparados solo para poner en la parrilla, por lo generar se compra para la cena.

Este suele ser carne asada, pollo frito, tajadas con queso, pollo asado, enchiladas, chancho con yuca……etc.
El quinto integrante del grupo es José V. de 22 años el junto a su compañera de vida tiene una panadería donde producente todo tipo de panes los cuales distribuyen en las ventas locales.
texts.en:
The group Las Azucenas (the Lillies) is made of five hard-working members with initiative. One of them is María del Socorro U. C., who is 22 years old. She started out selling tortillas and enchiladas, and now she sells meat.

Alba Lidia G. G., 24 years old, has been selling food for two years in the free-port area of Masaya. Consuelo G., 52 years old, sells tortillas, and Fátima del Carmen Vichez has a small "fritanga," a popular restaurant in Nicaragua par excellence. She sells fried foods that are prepared to be grilled, which people usually buy for dinner. She usually sells roasted meat, fried chicken, fried plantains with cheese, roasted chicken, enchiladas, pork with cassava, etc.

The fifth member of the group is José V., who is 22 years old. Together with his life partner he has a bakery where they make all kinds of bread that they distribute to local shops.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat

loans.name: Olajumoke

texts.en: Olajumoke has a salon and she also sells clothes at various prices. She is 30 years old and married with two children. This is the high season for her business and she hopes to meet the requirements of her clients. At the time of taking this photo, she was about to go to the market to purchase more goods because all of her goods were sold. She hopes for a loan of 150,000 naira to purchase more clothes and hair extensions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un padre de familia de 57 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y cuatro de sus siete hijos en el sector San Pedro de Sasape, ubicado en el distrito de Illimo, a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedicó exclusivamente a la agricultura hasta la edad de 30 años. Fue entonces cuando empezó a trabajar como pintor de edificios por recomendación de un amigo y desde entonces se ha desempeñado paralelamente en esas dos actividades siempre tratando de sacar a su familia adelante.

Las actividades que realiza no constituyen una fuente de ingreso consistente. Por lo tanto el desea tener en casa una fuente de ingreso más estable. Ha planeado instalar una pequeña bodega en casa con la cual pueda tener un ingreso permanente. Por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Manuel siempre ha querido ver a sus hijos desarrollarse por sí solos, por eso trata de facilitarles instrumentos de trabajo con los que puedan ganarse la vida. Desea que su hija se haga cargo de la tienda que planea instalar.

El es un padre muy responsable y que siempre anima a sus hijos a salir adelante. Su más grande anhelo es verlos convertidos en personas honorables y con un futuro prometedor. En la fotografía aparece en el lugar donde piensa instalar su nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Manuel is a 57 year old father. He lives with his wife and four of their seven children in the San Pedro sector of Sasape, which is located in the Illimo district 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He worked exclusively as a farmer until he was 30. Then he started to work as a building painter because of the recommendation of a friend. From then on he has worked at both of these activities at the same time. He is always trying to get his family ahead. These activities do not constitute a consistent source of income. Therefore, he would like to have a more stable source of income at home. He has planned to set up a small convenience store in his house. This could give him a steady income. That is why he is asking Edpyme Alternative, for the first time, for a loan of 1,000 PEN. Manuel has always wanted to see his children develop on their own. Therefore, he tries to provide work tools that they can use to earn a living. He wants his daughter to be in charge of the store he is planning to install. He is a very responsible father who always encourages his children to get ahead. His biggest aspiration is to see them become honorable people with a promising future. The photograph is of the place where he plans to install his new business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic needs products, groceries, and drinks to set up a general store

location.town: Sector San Pedro de Sasape - Illimo - Lambayeque

loans.name: Tejedoras2 Group

texts.es: El grupo de las tejedoras2 viendo sus necesidades acudieron a la asociaciòn ASDIR para ayudarles a incrementar sus capital ya que ellas tienen siete años a tras de estar realizando este tipo de compra y venta de ropa tipica  ya que ellas tambien las bordan a mano y se han unido para competir  ya que la competencia es fuerte y necesitan incrementar sus capitales y asi surtir màs sus mercaderia y ser competitivas y tener màs ventas para sostener sus hijos y de ellas misma ya que en el lugar que se encuentra es muy precario(pobre) y ellas tiene ese concepto ya que trabajando duro y teniendo ayuda ellas tendran mejor nivel de vida y de sus hijos para que sus hijos puedan seguir estudiando y superar.
texts.en:
Looking at their needs, the Tejedoras 2 Group came to the ASDIR Association to get help increasing their capital. They have seven years experience in this type of buying and selling of typical clothing. They also embroider by hand, and they have united to compete. The competition is strong, and they need to increase their capital to stock more merchandise and be more competitive. They need to have more sales to support their children and themselves. The place where they live is very poor. They believe that by working hard and with help they can have a better quality of life and that their children will be able to keep studying and be successful.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate is a hair stylist and she also sells hair extensions. She is 36 years old and married with four children. She has been in her business for a long time, and she is happy because this is the high season for her business. She hopes for a loan of 150,000 naira to purchase more hair extensions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell

loans.name: La Poma Group

texts.es:
Integrantes  3000   6000 María de la Concepción B. R. 5000

Isidra de Fátima L. B. de 38 años desde 1991 tiene una dulcería donde realiza postres y dulces tradicionales como pioquinto, piñonate, hojuelas, cajetas de leche y coco, papaya con piña,  etc.
Ella aprendió este oficio de su madre y comenzó a realizarlos para venta. Este negocio es unos de los que inicio  junto con Adim y han ido creciendo juntos. L. aseguro que lo que más le gusta es el sistema de trabajo ya que le es favorable.
Las otras integrantes son María de la Concepción Valtodano R. de 65 años realiza cajetas de leche y coco, piñonate, sapoyo (sapote en dulce), ayote en miel….etc. y  Rosa L. de 39 años desde 1990 se dedica a la agricultura de flores, plátanos y cítricos y a la crianza de aves de corral. A sus inicios solo criaba aves pero luego fue creciendo y empezó a cultivar.
texts.en:
Isidra de Fátima L. B., 38, has had a sweet shop since 1991. She makes desserts and traditional sweets like “pioquinto” (rum cake), “piñonate” (candied pine nuts), “hojuelas” (a type of fritter), “cajetas de leche y coco” (coconut caramels), and “papaya con piña” (papaya with pineapple), etc. She learned how to do this from her mother, and she started to make the sweets to sell. This is one of the businesses that she started with Adim, and they have been growing together. L. affirms that what she likes most about this system of work is that it is profitable. Another member is María de la Concepción Valtodano R., 65, who makes cajetas de leche y coco, piñonate, “sapoyo” (a candied regional fruit), and “ayote en miel” (squash and honey, similar to a sweet potato pie) etc. The third member, Rosa L., 39, has been growing flowers, bananas, and citrus since 1990. She also raises poultry. When she started she just raised birds, but then that was growing and she started to farm.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials like milk, sweetener, cinnamon, cloves, wood, cocoa, and papaya...etc. to make sweets

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola is not a hair stylist but she has a stall where she sells hair extensions, cream and cosmetics. She is 34 years old and married with a child. Her child is in the primary school in Lagos state. She has been in her business for nine years. She hopes for a loan of 100,000 naira to purchase more hair extensions and cosmetics to sell. She hopes to expand her business with this loan. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy and her husband have a grocery stall in their community. She is 26 years old and without a child. She is a hardworking woman and hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She is determined to lift her business above poverty. She hopes for a loan of 120,000 naira to purchase more grocery items to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items to sell

loans.name: Margaritas Group

texts.es: El grupo D. Margaritas acudieron a la Asociaicòn ASDIR para pedir un apoyo ya que viendo sus necesidad para para incrementar sus capitales ya que ellas se han unido para trabajar juntas y viajar  ya que ellas lo que quieren es tener un mejor D. vida ya que en los lugares que han venido es un lugar D. mucha pobreza y quieren que sus hijos ya no sufran como ellas y ellas quieren ver a sus hijos superados y tener mejor nivel D. vida ya que ellas se han dedicado a la compra y venta D. ropa tipica, y a si sacar sus familia avante y los hijos que estudien y el sueño màs granD. es tener una casa o un techo seguro y dejar las casas infrahumanas. Pot al motivo quieren pedir que se les apollen y quieren tener ese sueño D. superaciòn.
texts.en:
The Margaritas Group approached the ASDIR Association T. request help, in view of their need T. increase their capital. They have united T. work and travel together, given their goal of improving their lives. There is a great deal of poverty in the area they come from and they don't want their children T. suffer as they have. They want T. see their children get ahead and have a higher standard of living.

These women are dedicated T. buying and selling typical clothing, by which means they hope T. advance their families. Their dream is T. help their children, who are students, by providing a secure house or roof, leaving their sub-standard houses behind. For this reason, they wish T. ask that you help them realize their dream of advancement.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO FUND THEIR SALES OF TYPICAL CLOTHING

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria sells sarongs of various colours and shapes and she also sells shoes. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. She is 28 years old and married with two children. Her husband repairs computers. All her children are in school and she is determined to give them quality education. She hopes for a loan of 150,000 naira to purchase more sarongs and shoes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and shoes to sell

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es: El grupo de la Nueva esperanza acudieron a la Asociaciòn ASDIR para pedir el apoyo para incrementar sus capitales para sobresalir a la competencia ya que entre màs surtido tengan mejor venta puedan realizar  y puedan asi sacar a sus familias  ya que de ellos dependen  y ellas quieren sacar a sus hijos avantes  en sus estudios, para que no sufran como ellas y quieren tener mejorar sus sistema de nivel de vida y por ello acuden a que se le apoye.
texts.en:
The group Nueva Esperanza (New Hope) turned to the ASDIR association to ask for support to increase their capital so that they can stand out in the competition. With more supplies they can have improved sales and can help their families who depend on them. They want to move their children ahead in their studies so they will not suffer like them, and they want to improve their living standards. For all of these reasons they look for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase capital

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en: Pamela sells clothes to make a living. She is 37 years old and married with three children. She is a friendly and hardworking woman and she uses her friendliness to attract more customers to her stall. She hopes for a loan of 140,000 naira to purchase more clothes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity sells foodstuffs and sandals in her stall. She is 34 years old and married with three children. She has sold out of all the foodstuffs in her stall and she wants to purchase more to sell. She hopes for a loan of 150,000 naira to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Emprendedoras está conformado valga la redundancia esta conformado por tres féminas trabajadoras, emprendedoras y con visión. Una de ellas es Andrea Ivania A. de 29 años que desde 1999 comenzó junto con su esposo a vender especies. 

Este es un producto de gran demanda desde tiempos antiguos por su uso medicinal y culinario.  Alguno de estos son canela, chavo de olor, pimienta, ayote, curry, cilantro, orégano, albahaca, hoja de laurel, Azafrán, Anís, cebollino, hierba buena,  zacate de limón, laurel, jengibre,  menta, mostaza, paprika, perejil, sábila, romero, tomillo y vainilla…….etc.

Lo que más desea Áreas es tener un tramo en el mercado y dejar de vender de forma ambulante por el peligro que representa.
Las otras dos integrantes son Josefa Dolores R. L. de 47 años quien vende frutas como naranja, mandarinas, sandilla, melón, mango y jocotes entre otros e Isadora del Socorro L. de 27 años vende especies.
texts.en:
The group " Mujeres Emprendedoras" (Hardworking Women) is comprised of (forgive the repetition) 3 working women, who are enterprising and share a vision. One of these is Andrea Ivania A., who is 29 years old and has been selling spices along with her husband since 1999. Spices have been in great demand since ancient times for their medical and culinary uses. The spices they sell include: cinnamon, cloves, pepper, curry, coriander, oregano, basil, bay leaf, saffron, anise, chives, mint, lemon grass, bay leaf, ginger, mint, mustard, paprika, parsley, aloe vera, rosemary, thyme and vanilla. What Andrea most desires is to have a stand in the market so that she can stop selling in the streets because it is dangerous. The other members are Josefa Dolores R. L., who is 47 years old and sells fruits such as: oranges, mandarin oranges, watermelons, melons, mangos and plums among others, and Isadora del Socorro L. who is 27 years old and sells spices.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy spices

loans.name: Mayra Del Socorro

texts.es: Mayra del Socorro O. de 38 años tiene una pequeña pulpería en la comarca rural pilas orientales. La pulpería esta surtida con granos básicos y gaseosa pero ella necesita comprar otros productos de consumo para el hogar como  champú, jabones, detergente….etc. además ella produce y vende hamacas de gran calidad.
texts.en:
Mayra del Socorro O. is 38 years old and has a small grocery store in the rural area of Pilas Orientales. Her grocery store is stocked with staple grains and sodas, but she needs to purchase other consumer products for the home such as shampoo, soaps, detergent, etc. In addition, she makes and sells good quality hammocks.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shampoo, soaps, detergent, and staple grains

loans.name: Anabela's Group

texts.es: El grupo de 6 personas llegaron a la Asociciòn ASDIR  para pedir ayuda, para incrementar  sus capitales ya que ellos se dedican a la compra y venta de ropa tipica, y esto a servido para el mantenimiento coticiano para la susistenicia y ellas quiren seguir apoyando a sus hijos e hijas para tener un mejor nivel de vida y para ello acuden para apoyarles en sus capitales y asì poder tener màs sutido sus mercancia y vender a otros pueblos la ropa tipica.
texts.en:
This group of 6 persons came to the ASDIR Association to ask for help to increase their capital; they are engaged in the business of buying and selling clothes in styles that are typical of the area. This business has served to provide their daily needs for sustenance and they want to continue to support their sons and daughters so that they can have a higher standard of living. For this reason they look for support to increase their capital; in this way they can have a greater supply of merchandise and can sell their clothing in other towns.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase capital

loans.name: Grupo Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es: En el año del 2006 se organizaron un grupo de 13 personas  con el fin de empezar un negocio que pueda  ayudar a las familias de escasos recursos del municipio de Momostenango, Guatemala y de esa manera combatir la pobreza que existe en estos lugares para ello fueron a la Asociación ASDIR a solicitar un préstamo el cual según análisis realizados  con la solicitud se determino que es factible poder ayudarlos y de esa manera contribuir a que sus sueños se hagan realidad y de la misma manera las personas han empezado a  emprender un negocio el cual  Las personas integrantes del grupo se dedican mayormente al comercio a la venta de ropa y a la venta  de verduras y el resto de las integrantes se dedican a la crianza de cerdos pollos y en algunas de ellas se dedican al Servicio de tienda de Consumo Diario.
texts.en:
In the year 2006, a group of 13 people organized with the goal of beginning a business that could help families of scarce resources in the town of Momostenango, Guatemala, and in this way, combat the poverty that exists in those places. To do this, they went to the ASDIR Association to solicit a loan, which they were granted after tests were conducted to determine if it was feasible to help them and, in this manner, contribute to making their dreams a reality. In the same way, these people have started a business. The members of the group are, for the most part, dedicated to selling clothing and produce and the rest of the members raise pigs and chickens and some of them are dedicated to grocery stores.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for business.

loans.name: Chorn

texts.en:
Chorn C. would like to take out a loan of $1000 US to complete her house construction. She is a professional tailor who is able to make $2 US profit every day. Her husband is a construction worker building houses and earning $3 US per day. Chorn C. is 48 years old and lives with her husband in Phnom Penh. This couple has three children: two are garment factory workers and one is a student. 
Chorn is pictured with her husband and her mother.

loans.use: To complete her house construction

loans.name: Vuon

texts.en: Vuon S., 30, is married and lives with her husband in Phnom Penh. She works as a grocery seller with her husband. They typically make $5 US profit a day. This couple has two young children. Vuon S. is asking for a loan of $1000 US she needs to reinvest in her grocery store. The rest will be used to purchase a motorbike for family transportation.

loans.use: To reinvest in her grocery store

loans.name: Leang

texts.en:
Leang M., a 47-year-old married woman with two children, lives with her family in Phnom Penh. She works in a grocery store, where she typically earns approximately US$5 per day. Her husband, Ouk Sovan, meanwhile, is a construction worker (he builds houses), which normally allows him to earn approximately US$4 per day.

Leang is now seeking a loan in the amount of US$1,100 to reinvest in her grocery business.

loans.use: To expand and improve her grocery business

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Neang K. is a 34-year-old man living with his family in Phnom Penh. To earn a living, he sells ice to local customers, which enables him to generate approximately US$5 of profit per day. His wife, Chhun Sreyphors, is 29 years old, and she is a garment factory worker. By doing so, Chhun typically earns approximately US$2 of profit per day. Neang and Chhun have two young children.

Neang is now seeking a loan in the amount of US$200 to purchase additional ice to sell to his customers.

loans.use: To expand his business by purchasing additional ice

loans.name: Tun

texts.en:
Tun S. is a 54-year-old retired soldier who lives in Phnom Penh with his wife and two of his children. He typically receives approximately US$1 on account of his military service. His wife, Kong Phalla (pictured), is 44 years old, and she runs a grocery store in the local market. By doing so, she normally earns approximately US$4 of profit per day. Tun and Kong also receive financial support from one of their children, who is a construction worker.

Tun is now requesting a loan in the amount of US$1,000 so that his wife can expand her grocery store.

loans.use: To expand his wife's grocery store by purchasing additional inventory

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en: Phorn R., 54, is married and lives with her husband and five of her children in  Phnom Penh. She is a professional tailor who is able to make a  US$2  profit every day, while her husband, pictured here, sells sugar cane juice from home and makes US$1 a day. Three of the children are garment factory workers and two are in school. Phorn R. is asking for a loan of US$500 to fix her leaky roof which is very difficult in the rainy season.

loans.use: To fix a leaky roof.

loans.name: Tep

texts.en: Tep S., 35, sells wine and grocery items from home of Phnom Penh. She is a single woman who lives with her parents. She typically makes about US$3 each day, and would like a loan to expand her business. In order to increase her profits, Tep is asking for US$200 to purchase more grocery items to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Ung

texts.en: Ung C., 27, is married with two young children living at home in the Phnom Penh. She works in a grocery store, typically making US$2 each day.  Her husband, Sam Si, typically makes about US$4 each day working in a local organization. Ung C. would like a loan of US$600 to expand her grocery inventory to meet her customers' demands.

loans.use: To expand her inventory

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Kim S. is 36 years old and lives with her husband and two of her children in  Phnom Penh. Since 2007, she has been selling coffee to earn a living and is able to make about US$4.50 of profit per day, while her husband runs a moto-taxi business and is able to make around US$5 profit per day. Kim S. is asking for a loan of US$1000 to rebuild her coffee shop and the rest will be used to complete her houS. construction.

loans.use: To rebuild her coffee shop and to complete construction of her house

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Em T., 37, is married with three children living at home in Phnom Penh. She owns a grocery store, typically making US$1 each day.  Her husband, Chan Hoeun is a construction worker who  builds houses. He typically makes about US$4 each day. Em T. would like a loan of US$500 to reinvest in her grocery business.

loans.use: To reinvest in her grocery business

loans.name: Chuon

texts.en: Chuon S. is 32 years old and lives with her husband and three of her children in  Phnom Penh. Since 2006, she has been selling sugar cane juice to earn a living and is able to make about US$5 in revenue each day, while her husband is a moto-taxi driver who is able to make US$3.50 per day. Chuon S. is asking for a loan of US$1000  to invest in a new business. She will purchase phones  and provide service to those who need to make phone calls.

loans.use: Service phone calls.

loans.name: Zabi Ahmadi Group

texts.en:
This is Zabi Ahmadi group. There are four members in this group. Zabiullah is the group leader. Zabiullah wants to take out a loan for his tailoring business. He wants to buy the essential materials for his shop.

Rohullah wants to take out a loan for selling rechargeable phone cards. Freshta wants to take out a loan for her beauty salon to buy cosmetics and complete her other necessary materials. Freba wants to take out a loan for her embroidery business.

They have requested a group loan of 56,000 Afghani. They are all thankful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: completing their business requirements

loans.name: Marina Masjedy Group

texts.en:
Shabobo is the group leader of 'Marina Masjedy' group. There are three members in this group. All of them would like to receive money for their businesses. They have requested a group loan of 56000 Afghani for their businesses.

Shabobo wants to take out a loan for her business of quilt sewing, and she wants to buy necessary materials for her business. Also Arafa wants to take out a loan for her business of tailoring in her house. She wants to buy a new machine for her business.

And Chana Gull wants to take a loan for her husband’s general store. He wants to make his shop larger. They are very happy with this loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: purchasing their required business materials

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn P. is from the village of Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 32 years old. Evelyn is married and has 3 school-age children. To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from a variety store business and having a retail gasoline station as an additional investment. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Evelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Evelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Sha Nawaz Group

texts.en:
Parwen is the group leader of 'Sha Nawaz' group. There are four members in this group. All of them would like to receive money for their businesses. Parwen and Bibi Safya want to take out a loan for their husband’s general stores. They want to expand their businesses.

Dall J. and Farzana want to a take out a loan for their tailoring businesses. They would like to buy necessary materials for their businesses. They have requested a group loan of 56,000 Afghani and want to thank Kiva lenders a lot.

loans.use: expanding their businesses

In 2009, Visitacion joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Visitacion is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Visitacion from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira M. is from the village of San Juan in Gingoog City. She is 42 years old, married, and has one adult-age child. To make a living, Elvira owns and operates a business venture in the "services" sector. More specifically, she provides manicure and pedicure services to local community members. In addition, she operates a food vending business. Elvira has been engaged in her business ventures for over a year, and she earns approximately 1,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2009, Elvira joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services and to thereby improve her living situation as well as her ability to engage in business activities. Notably, Elvira has already successfully repaid a prior loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP ($125) from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Elvira is now requesting another loan through HSPFI, also in the amount of 5,000 PHP ($125), which will be used to invest in expanding her businesses. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the businesses as a result of the loan to supplement the income of her family and to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City, and it reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business ventures

location.town: San Juan, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria R. is a 72-year-old married woman from the village of Manticao. To make a living, Victoria owns and operates a business venture in the food sector. More specifically, she makes and sells food -- primarily snacks and other delicacies for her local community members. Victoria has been engaged in her business for over 5 years, and she earns approximately 2,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2009, Victoria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services and to thereby improve her living situation as well as her ability to engage in business activities. Victoria is now requesting a loan in the amount of 4,000 PHP ($100), which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make foods to sell to her customers. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Victoria through HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated as a result of this loan to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City, and it reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional raw ingredients

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph N. is from the village of Brgy. 24, Gingoog City. He is 43 years old. Joseph is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Joseph runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Joseph has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Joseph joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joseph has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Joseph is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the third loan taken out by Joseph from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of his children, to pay bills and for land installments. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.
