loans.name: Badam Ghorband Group

texts.en:
Ashaqallah is the group leader of 'Badam Ghorband' group. There are six members in this group. All of them would like to receive money for their businesses. They have requested a group loan of 60,000 Afghani.

Ashaqallah and M. Nasar want to take a loan for their businesses selling wood. They want to make their shops larger. And Farid and Abdull Qadeir want to take a loan for their restaurant business. They want to buy new chairs and tables for their restaurant. Bibi Sharen and Meir Ahmad want to take a loan for their carpentry shops. They need the loan for purchasing wood and want to buy a new machine for their carpentry businesses.

loans.use: expanding their businesses and buying materials

loans.name: Kulumbu's Group

texts.en:
Kulumbu, the leader of this group, is a widow.  She has raised six children: four daughters and two sons. Her 21-year-old daughter and 17-year-old son still live with her. The other children are married and live on their own.  Kulumbu is 49 and engages in animal husbandry, as her parents did when she was a child.  Kulumbu keeps some cattle and sells milk. The cattle provide her and her family with meat in sufficient amounts and when needed, she sells some of cattle to meet daily needs. For 30 years, Kulumbu has successfully raised her children to love hard work. Kulumbu earns her living mostly by selling milk, which brings her about $35 a month. Kulumbu is seeking a loan to buy a calf for breeding. She wants to build a big shed and increase the number of her cows.

Kulumbu’s partners are: Kaparbek, Gulnara and Baktygul. 

Kaparbek, 52, has four children. Kaparbek provides for his family by raising cattle. His monthly income is around $70. Kaparbek needs a loan to buy two sheep for feeding. Kaparbek has already bought a car. Now he wants to finish building his shed.

Gulnara, 40, has two children and is engaged in animal husbandry, selling milk. She also runs a small shop near their house. Her husband works as a driver. Gulnara decided to build her life in rural area and preferred a quiet village to a bustling city. Gulnara has applied for this loan to buy a calf for feeding and resale.

Baktygul, 37, is a mother of four children. She trades in consumer goods at her house. Her husband is a bus driver. Baktygul needs a loan to purchase confectionery, detergent, soap, and beverage, to increase her inventory turnover.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy a calf for breeding and resale

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en:
Seraphine is a 60-year-old mother of four who runs a salon in Machokos, a busy market town near Nairobi. She has been in this business for two years and previously sold clothes. She also earns extra income through some small-scale farming.

She is requesting a loan of  Kes. 30,000 to buy cosmetics for her shop. She describes herself as confident and determined and hopes to expand her business and eventually become a wholesale outlet.

About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics for her beauty shop.

loans.use: To add stock to his shop.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 61 years old and a widow with four children. She sells sarongs and plastics of various colors and shapes. She is a hard working woman. She sells daily in her stall from 8am-6pm. She hopes for a loan of N120,000 to purchase more sarongs and plastics to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and plastics to sell

loans.name: Chizoron

texts.en: Chizoron sells foodstuffs in Lagos State, Nigeria.  She is determined to excel in her business and family life. She is 32 years old and married, with 2 children.  Her husband is very supportive of her business, and her children attend a private primary school. She is seeking a loan of N120,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Los Amigos Group

texts.es:
el grupo Los Amigos esta integrado por 3 personas las cuales son muy unidas, tienen mucho tiempo de conocerse y son como hermanos, ellos se han  ayudado toda la vida, siempre han salido juntos, la amistad que ellos tienen es muy especial, a continuacion se detalla las diferentes actvidades que ellos realizan:
la sra. Valentina M. Valdes es la coordinadora del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, ella tiene una pulperia en la cual vende refrecos, condimentos, tortillas, cafe, pan, galletas, pelotas, sardinas, chiles, embutidos, lacteos, arroz, azucar etc. sus clientes la quieren mucho ya que ella les da un trato muy especial, adeamas que sus precios son muy buenos. ella necesita el credito para poder salir adelante con su negocio y su familia.
el sr. Mario A. tambien se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia la cual es su unica fuente de ingresos, el nos comento que se siente muy feliz ya que su negocio cada vez va creciendo mas, el desea comprar mas variedad de productos y asi ofrecer a sus clientes prodcutos a un precio bajo y de buena calidad.
el sr. Santos Agustin G. tiene una pequeña fabrica de produccion de ladrios de barro, este negocio es muy bueno en esta zona ya que la mayoria de las casas las fabrican con este tipo de ladrillo por ser muy economico, es mucho mas barato que el ladrillo normal, el necesita el credito para comprar mas materiales para la fabricacion de sus ladrillos.
todos ellos necesitan el credito para poder salir adelante, una de las caracteristicas mas especiales de este grupo es que son unas personas honrradas.
texts.en:
The Amigos Group is comprised of three very united members. They have known each other for a long time, and they are like siblings. They have helped each other all of their lives. They have always gone out together. The friendship that they have is very special. Below are the details of the activities they do. Valentina M. Valdes is the coordinator of the group. She sells popular consumption products. She has a mini-market. She sells soft drinks, condiments, tortillas, coffee, bread, crackers, balls, sardines, chilies, canned goods, dairy products, rice, and sugar, etc. Her customers love her a lot because she gives them very special treatment. Also, her prices are very good. She needs the loan to get ahead with her business and her family. Mario Aviola also sells popular consumption products. He has a mini-market, which is his only source of income. He tells us that he feels very happy because his business is growing more each time. He wants to buy a greater variety of products. That way he can offer his customers good quality products at a low price. Santos Agustin G. has a small factory, which produces clay bricks. This business is very good in this region because the majority of the houses are made with this type of brick. It is very economical and much cheaper than normal bricks. He needs the loan to buy more materials to make the bricks. All of them need the loan to be able to get ahead. One of the most special characteristics of this group is that they are honorable people.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy dairy products, soft drinks, sugar, rice, coffe, bread, corn and wheat flour, tortillas, crackers, preserves, juice, canned goods, chilies, pastas, salsas, condiments, materials to make bricks

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Xenia Jaquelin

texts.es:
la sra. Xenia G. tiene una pulperia, esta es su unica fuente de ingresos, ella decidio poner este tipo de negocio porque asi ella no descuida a su familia y esta trabajando siempre, ya que su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion. esto le permite abrir su negocio muy temprano y cerrarlo a las 10 de la noche todos los dias.
ahorita Xenia necesita el credito para comprar mas productos a precio de mayorista, asi les gana mas.
nos comento que ella tiene pensado a corto plazo hacer mas grande su negocio, dice que poco a poco lo va a hacer crecer para poder tener al final un mercadito en donde todos los clietes que vengan siempre compren algo y no se vayan con las manos vacias.
Xenia es una persona muy simpatica y muy amable, fue grato estar un momento con ella.
texts.en:
Xenia G. has a mini-market, which is her only source of income. She decided to set up this type of business because that way she does not neglect her family. She is always working because her business is located in her house. This allows her to open her business very early and to close it at ten at night everyday. Xenia needs a loan now to buy more products wholesale. That way she earns more. She tells us that in the short term she is thinking of making her business bigger. She says that, little by little, she will make it grow to be able to finally have a market. In that marker all of the customers who always come to buy something will not go away empty handed. Xenia is a very nice and very kind person. It was pleasant spending time with her.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy salsas  mayonaise, mustard, soft drinks, churros, preserves, bread, crackers, oil, shortening, beans, sugar, rice, coffee, salt, spaghetti noodles, condiments, sardines, chile, powdered milk, and dairy products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Olga Zulema

texts.es:
la señora Olga Zulema M. tiene 27 años de edad, vive en union libre con el señor Rigoberto Lainez, de ellos dependen hijos uno de ellos esta en el kinder.
olga tiene un negocio en el interior del mercado municipal de nacaome, vende zapatos de hombre y de mujer, niños y niñas. este negocio lo tiene desde hace 3 años.
Xenia tambien sale a vender en varios negocios que estan en diferentes municipios del departamento de Valle.
Xenia esta solicitando el credito para surtir mas su negocio y comprar muchos productos para la epoca de navidad, ya que esta epoca es muy buena para vender zapatos. 
tiene que viajar a la frontera con El Salvador para comprar mas mercaderia y se le hace muy dificil y gasta mucho estar viajando a cada rato.
texts.en:
Olga Zulema M., 27, is in a common law marriage with Rigoberto Lainez. They have children, and one child is in kindergarten. Olga has a business inside of the Nacaome Municipal Market. She sells men’s, women’s, and children’s shoes. She has had this business for three years. Olga also sells to various businesses that are in different municipalities in the Valle department. Olga is asking for a loan to better stock her business and to buy a lot of products for the Christmas season. This season is very good for selling shoes. She needs to travel to the border with El Salvador to buy more merchandise. It is very difficult for her, and it costs her a lot to be traveling every so often.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy men’s, women’s, and children’s shoes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hilda Senayda

texts.es:
La señora Hilda Senaida M. Lainez tiene 36 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Rafael Lainez quien vende mercaderia. 
Tienen tres hijos los cuales todos estan en el colegio. 
Hila se dedica a la compra y venta de lacteos como ser queso, mantequilla, quesillo, requeson.  hilda vende el producto en Alinza, Caridad, Aramecina y el mercado de Nacaome. 
 
Sus ventas son cada tres dias por la seman, vende mas los fines de semana. 
Ella esta solicitando el crédito para surtir mas su negocio.
su meta es poder vender mas en otros caserios y pueblos de Nacaome, asi tendria muchas ganancias.
su sueño es ver graduados a sus hijos de la universidad.
texts.en:
Señora Hilda Senaida M. Lainez is 36 years old and is married to Señor Rafael Lainez, who sells merchandise. They have three children who all attend school. Hila purchases and sells dairy products such as cheese, butter, quesillo, and cottage cheese. Hilda sells her products in Alinza, Caridad, Aramecina, and the Nacaome market. She sells her products during the week but makes the majority of her sales during the weekend. She is requesting the loan to help purchase more products and increase her business. Her goal is to increase her sales in the surrounding villages and the towns of Nacaome so that she can increase her earnings. Her dream is to see her children graduate from university.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase dairy products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ciriaca

texts.es:
la señora Ciriaca C. B. tiene un hijo que depende de ella, Ciriaca se dedica a la venta de lacteos dentro del mercado de Nacaome y su deseo es poder graduar a su hijo de la universidad.

las ventas las realiza diariamente, viaja de su lugar de origen, la aldea aguafrillita Guascoran Valle, su negocio esta ubicado en el interior del mercado municipal.
con este negocio ella ha logrado sacar adelante a su hijo en cual esta estudiando y ya le falta poco para salir de la universidad.
esto le ha motivado mucho a Ciriaca ya que esta viendo los frutos de su trabajo.
nos comento que se siente muy cansada pero que toda via tiene fuerzas para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Señora Ciriaca C. B. has a son whom she supports. Ciriaca sells dairy products in the Nacaome market and her wish is to have her son graduate from university. She travels every day from her home in a village in the Guascoran Valley to sell her products in the city market. Through her business she has been able to support her son who is in school and is close to finishing his education at the university. Her son has motivated her and she is seeing the fruits of her labor. She commented that she is tired but has the strength to move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase dairy products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
la señora Maria Guadalupe H. tiene 57 años de edad, es soltera, no tiene hijos y se dedica a la venta de ropa, sandalis y los fines de semana vende baleadas desde hace 05 años.
Maria necesita el prestamo para surtir su negocio para navidad ya que esta es una epoca en la cual las ventas se ponen muy buenas y asi poder tener mas ganancias.
Maria los fines de semana pone un puesto de venta de baleadas las cuales las vende todas, este tipo de comida es muy apetecida por los habitantes de esta zona, ya que una baleada con frijolitos fritos, huevo, mantequilla, queso y jamon es una delicia al comersela y es un alimento completo.
su sueño es tener un negocio fuerte en el mercado de San Lorenzo.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Guadalupe H. is 57 years old, unmarried, and has no children. She has been selling clothing and sandals for five years. In addition, she sells baleadas, a Honduran burrito, on the weekends. Maria needs a loan to stock her business in preparation for the Christmas season. In the time leading up to Christmas she makes many sales and can increase her earnings. On the weekends she has a stall where she sells baleadas, which are very popular amongst the people living in her area. They are made with refried beans, eggs, butter, cheese, and ham. They are delicious and a complete meal. Her dream is to have a thriving business in the San Lorenzo market.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bedding, underwear, socks, sandals, and shirts

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Daisy Xiomara

texts.es:
la señora Daisy Xiomara I. P. tiene 36 años de edad, es casada con el señor Ciriaco Castillo quien labora en una empresa como guardia de seguridad, dependen de ellos tres hijos que estan estudiando en el colegio de la comunidad de san lorenzo.
su negocio es la venta de abarroteria y granos basicos su negocio esta ubicado en el interior del mercado municipal de San Lorenzo, vende maiz, frijoles, arroz, maisillo, cloro, café, azucar etc. 
necesita el prestamo para comprar mas producto y asi abastecer mas su negocio. 
quiere poder abastecerce para la navidad ya que en esa fecha se vende mucho y se obtienen muchas ganancias.
texts.en:
Daisy Xiomara I. P., 36, is married to Ciriaco Castillo. He works for a business as a security guard. They have three children who are dependent upon them. The children go to school in the San Lorenzo community. Her business is selling groceries and basic grains. Her business is located inside the San Lorenzo Municipal Market. She sells corn, beans, rice, sorghum, chlorine, coffee, and sugar, etc. She needs the loan to buy more products to better stock her business. She wants to stock up for Christmas. On that date she sells a lot and gets great earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy eggs, salsas, canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, rice, sugar, tortillas, bread, crackers, shortening, oil, milk, cheese, butter, and churros

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Melida

texts.es:
la sra. Melida S. M. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, ella tiene una pulperia, esta es su unica fuente de ingresos, ella se siente muy feliz ya que este negocio le ayuda a salir adelante con sus gastos de su hogar, su negocio esta en su casa de habitacion, esto le permite descanzar cuando no esta atendiendo clientes, Melida es una sra. de edad pero con unas fuerzas como si tuviera 30 años.
su meta es poder pasar tanquila y no tener necesidades en los años que viene.
texts.en:
Melida S. M. sells basic groceries and has a convenience store, which is her only source of income. She is happy that this business helps her to keep up with her household expenses. Her business is home-based, which enables her to rest when she is not attending to customers. Melinda is elderly but has as much vitality as a 30-year-old. Her goal is to be able to live in peace and not want for anything in the years to come.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soft drinks, water, juices, sardines, soap and other goods for her store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge es el nombre de este simpático joven que a sus 23 años ya está creciendo en el mundo de los  negocios, él vive con sus padres y hermana en su amplia casa. 
A pesar de su corta edad aprendió a enfocarse en el mundo de los negocios y se proyecta a crecer económicamente, ya que tiene dos motocarros que son de su propiedad, en uno él mismo presta servicio de movilidad y el otro lo da en alquiler a un joven conocido. Desde hace 7 años se dedica a este oficio y lo realiza durante todos los días, no hay feriados ni fines de semana porque él quiere superarse y sabe que con sacrificio lo logrará. Además, las ganancias son netas y así puede ayudar a sus padres, ya que el negocio es muy rentable porque el servicio de motocarros es muy requerido por la zona donde vive, y él ya es conocido, pues su servicio genera confianza. Para el futuro Jorge quisiera tener una flota de motocarros y darlos en alquiler para crecer aún más, ya que a sus 23 años ha conseguido mucho, por este motivo es el orgullo de sus padres y no descansará hasta conseguir cumplir con sus metas.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP, por lo que promete, una vez más, ser responsable como con en el primero, y quiere seguir trabajando responsablemente para surgir, pues tiene toda una vida por delante. El dinero que solicita lo utilizará en la adquisición de un nuevo motocarro y también reparará los otros dos que tiene, porque sabe que en los negocios así como se gana, también se debe invertir.
texts.en:
Jorge is the name of a likeable young man who at 23 years old is growing in the business world. He lives with his parents and sister in a large house. Despite his young age he has learned to concentrate on business and is expected to grow economically. He already owns two motorcycle taxis - one of them he drives himself and the other he rents to someone he knows. For the past 7 years he has done this every day, with no holidays or weekends off, because he wants to get ahead and knows that with sacrifice he will make it. His earnings are net profits with which he helps his parents. The business is very profitable because the motorcycle taxi service is very much in demand where he lives, and since he is well known his service is trusted. In the future Jorge would like to have a fleet of motorcycle taxis and rent them out to grow even more. At 23 years old he has accomplished a lot, which makes his parents proud, and he will not stop until he has achieved all his goals. This is his second loan with MFP and it is expected that, once again, he will be as responsible as with his first loan. He wants to keep working responsibly to progress and has his whole life ahead of him. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a new motorcycle taxk as well as repair ther other two he has, because he knows that in business as you earn you must also invest.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a motorcycle taxi and repair the two he owns.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José es un joven emprendedor de 24 años, vive con sus padres y sus 6 hermanos menores en una modesta, pero bien construida casa de un populoso barrio al sur de la ciudad de Lima.
Este muchacho, a pesar de su corta edad, no le huye a las responsabilidades y le sobran ganas de salir adelante. Se levanta muy temprano para trabajar y pensando en tener una mejor vida que se hará realidad en un futuro no muy lejano. Aunque su familia tuvo que pasar muchas dificultades José nunca perdió las esperanzas de sobresalir y ya lo esta logrando. Él es carpintero de oficio y trabaja en el taller de un familiar; adicionalmente, tiene en su casa una bodega donde vende diferentes productos comestibles que es atendida amablemente por su madre, quien la ostentaba al principio, pero después él se hizo cargo de la mercadería.
Su  negocio le es rentable porque le genera buenas ganancias económicas que le permiten ayudar a su familia, sobretodo a sus hermanos menores. Él tiene muchos sueños por cumplir y es por eso que trabaja incansablemente a pesar de su corta edad. Una de las tantas metas que tiene en la vida por cumplir es tener su propia carpintería, además de ampliar su tienda y surtirla con más y mejores productos de calidad.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y ya piensa en sacar otros créditos que le permitan crecer y mejorar cada día, también manifiesta que siempre es muy cumplido con sus pagos, y que el dinero del crédito lo invertirá en surtir la tienda de comestibles que administra con su madre.
texts.en:
José is a young 24-year-old entrepreneur who lives with his parents and 6 younger siblings in a modest but well-built house in a lower-income neighborhood in south Lima. This young man, in spite of his youth, does not avoid his responsibilities and has a lot of drive to get ahead. He gets up very early to work and thinks about having a better life in the future. Although his family went through many difficulties, José never lost hope that he would excel and now he is succeeding. He is a carpenter by trade and works in a relative´s workshop. In addition, he has a home-based convenience store where he sells a variety of groceries and which is run by his mother, who showed it off at first, but later he took over. His business is profitable and generates earnings which allows him to help his family, most of all his younger siblings. He has many dreams to fulfill and that is why he works tirelessly despite his young age. One of his many goals is to have his own carpentry workshop, in addition to expanding his store and stocking it with more and better-quality goods. This is his first loan with MFP and he plans to take out other loans which will allow him to grow. He also says that he always meets his payments on time and his will use his loan to stock the grocery store he runs with his mother.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre muy alegre y soñador, tiene 40 años y está casado con el amor de su vida, Maribel de 35 años, con ella tiene dos hijos varones; Luis de 16 y Jesús de 13 años.
Él se siente orgulloso de su familia, y por ella se esmera todos los días en trabajar en cada una de las fachadas que debe pintar para grandes empresas. Este oficio lo realiza solo y remodela cada estructura que debe pintar como si fuera su propia casa, no importa si el trabajo lo realiza desde altas paredes, lo importante es dejarlas relucientes. Luis deja tan bien pintadas las fachadas de las empresas que lo contratan, que se da el lujo de tomarles una foto de un antes y después, para enseñarles a sus nuevos clientes, quienes miran sorprendidos las fotos y se animan a contratarlo. El negocio es muy rentable porque siempre hay empresas que quieran mejorar su aspecto institucional, pues la fachada es la primera impresión en un local, es por eso que Luis sabe aprovechar esta necesidad, y ya tiene planes para el futuro porque tiene ideado poner un taller en su casa, el cual sea el centro de operaciones y contratar a otras personas para que lo ayuden en el servicio que brinda.

Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP y esta más que contento con los resultados de cada inversión, es por eso que es muy responsable con cada uno de sus pagos. Ya tiene casi listo todo para el taller, para empezar invertirá el dinero que ahora solicita en materiales y herramientas nuevas, porque las que tiene están gastadas de tanto trabajar.
texts.en:
Luis is a happy man, and he is a dreamer. He is 40, and he is married to the love of his life, Maribel, who is 35. They have two sons; Luis is 16 and Jesús is 13. He feels proud of his family. It is for them that he does his best everyday to work on each one of the facades that he needs to paint for the big companies. He does this job alone, and he remolds each structure that he needs to paint as if it were his own house. It does not matter if he has to work from high walls. The important thing is to leave them sparkling. Luis leaves the facades so well painted that the businesses have contracted him. That gives him the luxury of taking a before and after photo to show to new customers. They are surprised when they look at the photos, and it encourages them to hire him. The business is very profitable because there are always businesses that want to improve their institutional look. The façade is the first impression of a place. That is why Luis knows how to take advantage of this necessity. He has future plans to put a shop in his house. That would be the center of operations, and he would hire other people to help him in providing his services. This is his third loan with MFP. He is more than happy with the results of each investment. That is why he is very responsible with each one of his payments. He already has almost everything ready for the shop. To start he will invest the money that he is now asking for in buying materials and new tools because the ones he has are worn out from so much work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tools and materials for painting

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es una madre de familia de 46 años, vive con su esposo (Roberto), de 48 años; con él tiene 4 jóvenes hijos; Cristopher de 21, Ylene de 19, Gianfranco de 17 y Gabriela de 14 años, todos ellos son el orgullo de sus padres.
Ella es una mujer emprendedora que no le tiene miedo a los retos, es por eso que desde hace 6 años empezó con la venta de gas (balones) en su casa. Al principio trabajaba como distribuidora para otra persona, pero desde hace un año ella es la dueña de su negocio; ya tiene dos locales y trabaja con dos jóvenes que la ayudan en las labores del reparto de los balones. 
En este negocio también la apoyan sus hijos y esto la hace muy feliz porque el negocio ha crecido en poco tiempo y es muy rentable. A Victoria le gusta su trabajo porque no es pesado y  ella sólo lo administra, trabaja directamente con una empresa de gas reconocida en el Perú que brinda garantía, pues Victoria dice que no importa que gane menos lo importante es brindar seguridad a los clientes que le compran el gas mensualmente, y ya se ha ganado la confianza de ellos. Para el futuro piensa tener sus propios locales ya que los actuales son alquilados y sueña con tener también sus propios camiones distribuidores de gas.

Este es su noveno préstamo con MFP, promete ser responsable como en los anteriores créditos. Además, sus compañeras de banco comunal también están muy comprometidas con cada uno de los créditos y ya conoce con quiénes trabaja. Como a Victoria le sobran las ganas de salir adelante, piensa invertir el dinero que ahora solicita en la compra de mercadería, más balones de gas, y así lograr conseguir la meta que se ha propuesto en la vida.
texts.en:
Victoria is a mother. She is 46 years old, lives with her husband (Roberto), and they have 4 young children: Cristopher, 21, Ylene, 19, Gianfranco, 17, and Gabriela, 14. All of them are the pride of their parents.

She is an enterprising lady who is not afraid of challenges and therefore she started selling gas (cylinders) 6 years ago at her house. In the beginning she worked as a distributor for another individual, but for the last year she has been the owner of her business. She has two premises and works with two young men who help her with the distribution of the cylinders.

She is also supported by her children and she is very happy as business has grown rapidly and is very profitable. Victoria likes her job as it is not a heavy one as she only administers. She works directly with a recognized gas company in Peru which gives warranty, and Victoria says it is not important that she earns less, the important thing is to offer security to the customers who buy gas on a monthly basis, and have confidence in her. For the future she plans to buy her own premises as the ones she uses now are rented and she dreams of having her own trucks for the distribution of gas.

This is her ninth loan with MFP, and she assures to be responsable as with her prior loans. Besides her partners at the community bank are also engaged with each of the loans and know the people she works with. As Victoria is very keen on getting ahead, she plans to invest the money requested in buying merchandise, more gas cylinders, and thus reach her life goal.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es:
Eugenio tiene 36 años, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 12 años se dedica a la agricultura, siembra papa, olluco, habas, y hortalizas como zanahoria, cebolla y arveja. Su esposa es su principal apoyo cuando realiza las diversas tareas del campo, también cría ganado vacuno en un pequeño establo que él mismo implementó en su casa. Por otro lado, los productos que cosecha los vende en el mercado de la ciudad aledaña, de esta manera puede ver los frutos de su esfuerzo, los cuales durante estos años ha consolidado la economía de su hogar y esa es la razón por la que desea intensificar sus cultivos y la adquisición de más animales.

Esta es la segunda oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP y está muy contento de formar parte de su banco comunal, donde se lleva muy bien con todos sus compañeros y compañeras. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono y alquiler de un tractor para su siguiente siembra.
texts.en:
Eugenio is 36 years old, lives with his wife and two children in his own home. For 12 years he has worked in agriculture growing potatoes, olluco (an Andean root vegetable), beans and vegetables such as carrots, onions and peas. His wife is his main support when he completes his diverse tasks in the field. He also raises cattle in a small cattle shed that he built next to his house. In addition, he sells the products that he harvests in a market in the city of Aledaña; in this way he is able to see the fruits of his labor. Over the years he has strengthened the economic situation of his household, and this is the reason why he wishes to increase his crops and acquire more animals. This is the second opportunity that he has had to get a loan from MFP, and he is very happy to be a part of his communal bank, where he gets along very well with all of his colleagues. The money that he is requesting now will be invested in the purchase of bags of fertilizer and to rent a tractor for the next harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to rent a tractor

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Gregorio tiene 43 años, vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 20 años se dedica en las tareas agrícolas y ganaderas, él sale todas las mañanas para observar sus tierras y estar pendiente del crecimiento de sus cultivos. Sus principales productos agrícolas son la papa, el olluco, la cebada y el trigo, pero los más rentables, en su caso, son la cebada y el trigo porque tiene mejores precios en el mercado. Adicionalmente, Gregorio cría vacas, ovejas y cerdos, en un lugar que preparó en su propio terreno, los cuales vende cada tres meses, luego de que han alcanzado el peso adecuado. 
Su deseo a futuro, como el de todo agricultor, es incrementar su producción e incrementar sus animales.

Esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito con MFP a su nombre, pues anteriormente era su esposa la titular de los créditos, siendo ambos muy reconocidos en su banco comunal por su responsabilidad. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de un torete para incrementar la cantidad de animales que tiene.
texts.en:
Gregorio is 43 years old and lives with his wife and 4 children in his own home. For the past 20 years he has worked in farming and ranching. He goes out each morning to check on his fields and to watch his crops grow. His main crops are potatoes, olluco (a small, potato-like tuber), barley and wheat, but the most profitable are barley and wheat because they have better prices on the market. In addition, Gregorio raises cows, sheep and pigs in a place that he fixed up on his land. He sells them every three months once they reach the right weight. His hope for the future, like all farmers, is to increase production and have more animals. This is the first time he has asked for a loan from MFP in his own name. Before, his wife was the borrower but both are known in their community bank for being responsible. The loan he requests will be used to buy a bull in order to increase the number of animals he has.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a bull.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda tiene 68 años, vive con su hijo D. 20 años en su casa propia. DesD. su niñez ha estado muy ligada a las diversas tareas agrícolas, y con el paso D. los años sigue siendo ésta, su fuente D. ingresos. D. esta manera también tiene disponible algunos alimentos que guarda en su despensa para el consumo D. su familia y así sus gastos son menores en la alimentación. 
Hilda siembra maíz, papa y también la alfalfa, la cual le sirve tanto para alimentar a sus animales, como para la venta. En algunas ocasiones su hijo la apoya con las tareas que requieren D. mayor esfuerzo físico. Asimismo, en algunas oportunidades Hilda trabaja recogiendo cosechas D. otras personas, pues desea incrementar sus ingresos. Su meta a futuro más cercana es D. mejorar su granja D. cuyes y aumentar la cantidad D. animales que cría.

Este es su 8vo crédito con MFP, ella es una integrante D. su banco comunal muy comprometida con su grupo, ya que es parte D. la junta directiva. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. galpones o jaulas para su granja D. cuyes.
texts.en:
Hilda is 68 years old. She lives with her 20-year-old daughter in her own house. Since childhood she has been closely linked to farming tasks and over the years it has remained her source of income. This way she also has food available to her, which she stores in her pantry for her familiy´s consumption and this lowers her food costs. Hilda sows corn, potatoes and also alfalfa, which she uses to feed her animals as well as sells. Sometimes her son helps her out for the tasks that require more physical effort. Also, on some occasions Hilda picks crops for others because she wants to increase her income. Her goal for the near future is to improve her guinea pig farm and increase the number of animals she raises. This is her 8th loan with MFP. She is a very committed member of her communal bank and is part of the board of directors. The loan she is requesting now will be invested in purchasing sheds or cages for her guinea pig farm.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make improvements to the cages for her guinea pigs.

loans.name: Florinda

texts.en:
Florinda V. R. is from the village of Green Hills Suarez, Iligan City. She is 59 years old. Florinda is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Florinda owns and operates a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling variety of products such as pillowcases, blankets, rice and more in the local community. Florinda has been engaged in her business for more than four years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Florinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florinda is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Florinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Suarez, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz tiene 43 años, vive con sus 3 hijos y sus padres en la casa propia de ellos. Hace 5 años decidió emprender su propio negocio brindando el servicio de fotocopiado a una universidad ubicada en otra ciudad. Luz eligió ese lugar porque es muy demandado el servicio que brinda y sus ingresos son seguros, además en esa ciudad la fotocopia por hoja tiene mayor precio que en su ciudad y esto le permite mayores ganancias. Por tal motivo, cada 15 días viaja para atender su establecimiento y siempre está al pendiente del buen funcionamiento de su máquina fotocopiadora. Sus hijos también la apoyan cuando tienen tiempos libres, pues son estudiantes. Luz desea mejorar su negocio y tener más máquinas fotocopiadoras para obtener mayores ganancias. 

Es la séptima oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es muy cumplida con su banco comunal y se compromete a seguir siéndolo con cada uno de sus pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de hojas por millar y algunos repuestos para el mantenimiento de su máquina fotocopiadora.
texts.en:
Luz is 43 years old and lives with her 3 children and parents in her parents´ house. Five years ago she decided to start her own business providing photocopying services at a university located in another city. Luz chose this place because the service she offers is in high demand and her income is assured. In addition, in that city the price per page for photocopying is higher than in her own city and this allows for higher profits. Every 15 days she travels to take care of her business and she is always watching out that the copier works well. Her children also help when they have free time from their studies. Luz would like to improve her business and have more photocopiers so she can earn more. This is the seventh time that she has a loan with MFP. She meets her obligations with her communal bank and promises to continue doing so with each of her payments. The money she now requests will be used to buy paper and some spare parts for the maintenance of the photocopier.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance for a photocopier and purchase of paper.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
Natalia tiene 32 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde su niñez se ha dedicado a las diversas tareas agrícolas, pero hace 2 años decidió incrementar sus ingresos económicos implementando una tienda de comestibles en su casa, donde vende todos los productos que no se producen en su localidad como el arroz, azúcar, menestras (lentejas y frijoles), entre otros productos. Debido a su buena atención y variedad de mercadería, Natalia ha visto que su tienda está siendo más concurrida y sus ventas cada vez más estables por lo que está dispuesta a seguir invirtiendo en ella.

Esta es la segunda oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es parte de un banco comunal, donde es muy responsable y puntual con sus pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes para su tienda, y con otra parte adquirirá sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Natalia is 32 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children in their own house. Since childhood she has worked at a variety of agricultural tasks, but 2 years ago decide to increase her income by setting up a grocery store in her house, where she sells goods that are not produced locally, such as rice, sugar, and legumes (lentils and beans) among other products. Because of her good service and variety of merchandise, Natalia has seen her shop become more popular and her sales become increasingly stable, so she is willing to keep investing in it. This is the second time she has had a loan with MFP. She belongs to a commual bank, where she is very responsible and punctual with her payments. The money she is requesting will be used to buy groceries for her store and with part of it she will buy sacks of fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of goods.

loans.name: Piedad

texts.es:
Piedad tiene 58 años, vive con su hija y su nieta en su casa propia. DesD. muy joven se ha dedicado a las actividades agrícolas, pero con el paso D. los años obtuvo un trabajo dependiente en la municipalidad D. su localidad donD. dedica la mayor parte D. su tiempo. Entonces, su hija es quien la ayuda en el cuidado D. los cuyes y gallinas que cría, los cuales venD. los fines D. semana, pero en caso D. que le sobren algunos animales los lleva a su casa para su consumo o para mantenerlos hasta su próxima venta.
Piedad desea mejorar sus ingresos económicos y entre sus anhelos está el D. tener mayor capital D. trabajo para poder comprar y vender más animales.

Es la octava vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es una D. las fundadoras D. su banco comunal y la que persevera con un buen ejemplo D. responsabilidad en su grupo. El dinero que ahora solicita será invertido en el incremento D. su capital D. trabajo, en cuyes y gallinas.
texts.en:
Piedad is 58 years old and lives with her daughter and granddaughter in her own house. Since she was young she has worked in farming, but over time she got a job with the municipality where she lives and she spends most of her time doing that. So her daughter is the one who helps her by taking care of the guinea pigs and chickens she raises and sells on the weekends. When she has any left over she takes them home for her own consumption or holds on to them until the next time she sells. Piedad would like to increase her income and one of her wishes is to have more working capital with which to buy and sell more animals. This is the eighth time she has a loan with MFP. She is one of the founders of her communal bank and one who sets a good example of responsibility in her group. The money she requests will be used to increase her working capital and for guinea pigs and chickens.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more animals.

loans.name: Glace

texts.en:
Glace V. is from the village of Tuod, Manticao Misamis Oriental. She is 24 years old. Glace is single. To make a living, Glace is starting a business venture operating a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling personal beauty products, such as lotion, cologne and others in the local community. Glace is just starting this business.

In September 2009, Glace joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Glace is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Glace from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sen

texts.en:
Sen H., 52, is a widow with four children. She resides in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, with her children. To make a living, she is engaged in a business of selling groceries at a local market. She is able to generate an income of US$5 per day as a primary source of income for her family. The family also is assisted by one of her children, who is currently employed as garment factory worker. She is able to earn an income of US$3 per day to help cover her mother’s household expenses. 

The members of H.’s family are seeking to improve their standard of living and to expand their current business. Therefore, H. is asking for a loan of US$1,000 to purchase more groceries to stock her store for sale. By doing so, H. hopes that her business will be successful so that she is able to generate extra income for future household use.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock the store

While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling green bananas in the local market and to community members as well. Riza has been engaged in her business for more than a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In September 2009, Riza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Riza is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Riza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Phou

texts.en:
Phou R., 70, is a widow with two children. She resides in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, with her children. To make a living, she is engaged in a business  selling various kinds of vegetables, earning  an income of approximately US$2 per day. The family also is assisted by one of her children, who is currently employed at a restaurant as a chef. She is able to earn an income of US$5 per day to help cover her mother’s household expenses. 

The members of R.’s family are seeking to improve their standard of living and to expand their current business. Therefore, R. is asking for a loan of US$1,200 to purchase various kinds of fruit to start another business besides selling vegetables. By doing so, R. hopes that her business will be successful so that she is able to generate extra income for future household use.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fruit

loans.name: Jesucita

texts.en:
Jesucita Y. is from the village of Luinab, Iligan City. She is 55 years old. Jesucita is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Jesucita operates a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling a variety of products like fruits, vegetables and dried fish eggs in the local community. Jesucita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jesucita joined HSPFI, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jesucita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Jesucita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

texts.en:
Sou S., 52, is a widow with three children. She resides in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, with her children. To make a living, she is engaged in a business of selling various kinds of fruit, fried potatoes and other food types for her existing and new customers, earning  an income of approximately US$5 per day as a primary source of income for her family. The family also is assisted by three of her children, who are currently employed as teachers at the local schools. They are able to earn a reasonable income to make a living and to help cover their mother’s household expenses. 

The members of S.’s family are seeking to improve their standard of living and to expand their current business. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of US$1,200 to purchase groceries to stock her store. By doing so, S. hopes that her business will go well so that she is able to generate extra income for future household use.

To make a living, Rosalinda owns and operates a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of fruits in the local market and to the local community members as well. Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for more than seven years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosalinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalinda is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rosalinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Yen S., 68, is married with four children. She resides in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, with her husband and children. The family also is assisted by three of her children, who are currently employed at a local garment factory. They are able to earn a reasonable income to make a living and to help cover their mother’s household expenses. 

The members of S.’s family are seeking to improve their standard of living and to expand their current business. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of US$200 to purchase more meatballs. loans.name: Jenusesa

texts.en:
Jenusesa J. is from the village of Brgy. Santiago, Iligan City. She is 42 years old. Jenusesa is separated from her spouse and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Jenusesa is starting a business venture operating a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling scrap and other metals in the local community. Jenusesa is just starting this business.

In 2009, Jenusesa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jenusesa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Jenusesa is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Jenusesa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

texts.en:
Siv C. is a married with three children. She resides in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, with her husband and children. To make a living, she is engaged in a business of selling a few types of fish for her existing and new customers at a local market, earning an income of approximately US$5 per day as a primary source of income for her family. The family also is assisted by her husband, who is currently employed at a private security company. He is able to earn a reasonable income to make a living and to help cover their household expenses. 

The members of C.’s family are seeking to improve their standard of living and to expand their current business. Therefore, C. is asking for a loan of US$1,200 to purchase fish to stock her store. By doing so, C. hopes that her business will do well so that she is able to generate extra income for future household use. (C. is wearing a brown hat and sitting at her stand to sell her fish. Her stand is near a vegetable vendor's stand.)

loans.use: To buy more fish to stock the store

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana L. is from Zone 3A, Del Carmen, Iligan City. She is 40 years old. Rosana is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosana owns & operates a business buying and selling eggs in the local community. Rosana has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosana is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP. These funds will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Rosana from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Em S., 40, is a widow with two young children. She lives in Phnom Penh. Since 1991, she has been making and selling cakes at the local market to earn a living. She is able to make about US$5 of profit every day and is aided by one of her children who is a garment factory worker. Em S. would like to take out a loan of US$600. She needs to purchase rice and more ingredients to make her cakes.

loans.use: To purchase rice and ingredients to make cake.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Sam P., 58, is married and lives with her husband and five of her children in Phnom Penh. She sells vegetables at the local market to earn a living and is able to make about US$3 of profit every day. Her husband is too old to operate a business so he stays at home take cares of his children. Four of the children are cleaners and are able to make US$2 each a day. Sam P. is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase a motorbike for family transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Chip

texts.en: Chip H., 48, is married and has five children. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia with her husband and children. To make a living, she is engaged in the business of growing rice and beans on her own plot of farmland, earning approximately an income of US $2 per day as a primary source of income for her family. The family is also assisted by her husband works with his wife at the rice field. Three of her children are employed at different workplaces in the town: as a gardener, a housekeeper, and a construction worker. They are able to earn a reasonable income to help cover the family’s household expenses. The members of H.’s family are seeking to improve their standard of living and to expand their current business. Therefore, H. is asking for a loan of US $800 to purchase more cows to help them at the field. By doing so, Channa hopes that her agricultural business will develop well so that she is able to generate extra income for future household use.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Gildanita

texts.en:
Gildanita L. is from the village of P-Rizal, Lugait, Misamis Oriental. She is 52 years old. Gildanita is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Gildanita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Gildanita has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gildanita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gildanita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP. These funds will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Gildanita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Soy

texts.en: Soy S. is 29 years old and lives with his wife in the city of Phnom Penh. He has a business renting out musical equipment. He is able to make about US$9 each day, while his wife, pictured here, sells vegetables and makes US$12 in revenue per day. Soy S. would like to take out a loan of US$1000.He needs to purchase a generator to assist his business.

loans.use: To purchase a generator.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch P., 57, is married and has five children. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia with her husband and children. She is engaged in the agriculture business of growing rice and raising pigs on her own plot of farmland, earning approximately an income of US $2.5 per day as a primary source of income for her family. The family is also assisted by Peav’s husband. He works with his wife at the rice field. Four of their children are employed at different workplaces in the town as a gardener and housekeeper, and the other two are construction workers. They are able to earn a reasonable income to help cover the family’s household expenses. The members of P.’s family are seeking to improve their standard of living and to expand their current business. Therefore, P. is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase more cows and pigs to help them at the field and raise more pigs for resale. By doing so, P. hopes that her agricultural business will go well so that she is able to generate extra income for the future household use.

loans.use: To buy more cows and pigs.

loans.name: Tin

texts.en: Tin M., 45, is married and lives with her husband and one of her children in the city of Phnom Penh. She makes and sells cakes to earn a living and is able to make about US$7 of profit every day. Her husband is a security guard, typically making US$5 per day. Tim M. would like to take out a loan of US$600. She needs to purchase rice, cake ingredients and a grinding mill.

loans.use: To purchase rice, ingredients and a grinding mill.

loans.name: Macaria

texts.en:
Macaria L. is from the village of Barangay, Santiago, Iligan City. She is 51 years old. Macaria is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Macaria owns & operates a business venture selling scrap metal & other used-products in the local community. Macaria has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Macaria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Macaria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Macaria is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP. These funds will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Macaria from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children.

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Nhov

texts.en: Nhov S., 34, is married and has three school-aged children. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia with her husband and children. To make a living, she is engaged a business of selling food at a nearby local market in the town, earning an income of approximately US $4 per day. The family is also assisted by her husband who is employed as a construction worker, earning an income of US $6 per day as a primary source of income for the family. Also, the members of S.’s family are seeking to improve their standard of living and to expand their current business. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of US $1200 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to commute to work easily. She thinks that this expected loan, used to invest in buying a new motorbike, will help her family to cut back on expenses of public transportation. She will be able to use the motorbike to transport goods from the market. By doing so, S. hopes that her business will go well so that she is able to generate extra income for the future household use.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike.

Since her breeding pigs business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing five more piglets, pig food, and a cow for breeding. She hopes to increase income and improve the family living with this loan. Mrs. Savy M. is a widow with a child who is too young to work or go to school.

loans.name: Emelie

texts.en:
Emelie is 39 years old and married to Orlando.  She and her family reside in San Andres, Aurora, Isabela. She is engaged in a dress making business and sometimes she also sells vegetables and cooked snacks in their village. Her business has been of great help in providing the school allowance for their children.  They have five children and they are all boys and three are studying.  

Her income is just enough to help her husband in providing for the needs of her family.  She is glad that her son, who is working in Bulacan, is helping them financially.  She now wants to borrow additional capital from the KIVA lenders amounting to PHP8,000 for the continuous improvement of her dressmaking and vending business.

loans.use: Additional capital for improvement of her small businesses

He is 40 years old and the father of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other two are enrolled in the local school. The youngest child is too young to work or study. His wife, Mrs. Seang Phall, is a fish seller in the local market. Mr. L. decided to ask for a loan to buy four more piglets, pig food, and fertilizers. He would use the rest of loan to buy more fresh fish to resell.

She hopes and prays that KIVA lenders will grant her loan in order for her to have a productive business.

loans.use: Additional capital for her beauty services

She is now borrowing a loan of PHP5,000.00 from KIVA lenders to be used to purchase more frozen foods that she will sell in their village. She is a vegetable vendor in the market.  She is 42 years old and married to Roger, 44 years old who works as a tricycle driver. She dreams that her children will finish their studies and have a more comfortable living standard.  

Anastacia wants to borrow a loan amount of PHP20,000 that she needs to improve her business. She will buy sacks of vegetables from different villages that she will then sell in the local market..

Leonila is 54 years old and married to Leopoldo, a farmer.  They have six children: Sherwin, 30 years old is a farmer, Ceasar is 26 years old,  Bernalu is 29 years old is at college level, Margarita is 23 years old, Bernie is 21 years old and their youngest is Christian who is 13 years old.  They reside in Baranggay Sta. Cruz, Alicia, Isabela, a rural and plain area. Their house is near the irrigation area.

Leonila has been engaged in the vegetable vending business for almost ten years.  She now wants to make a loan of PHP20,000 from the KIVA lenders to sustain her business.  Aside from that, she also sells processed foods for additional income.

Arlene is married to Reynaldo and they live in Marcos, Roxas, Isabela. Her husband works as a salesman in Abu Dabi while she manages her own sari-sari store (community based store). They are gifted with a son and he is now three years old.

Aside from her store, Arlene is also engaged in different businesses like hog-raising and the retailing of dry goods. She dreams that her son will finish his studies in the future.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
“Poverty is not a hindrance to success”  says Sally T. from the village of Poblacion, Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya. She is a widow and she has two children: Richard and Alaiza Faith. The eldest is now in 2nd year high school while the youngest is a grade VI student.  Despite the hardships and difficulties, she still has the strong faith and determination to give her children a better future by sending them to school.  

Sally is engaged in a rice retailing business as her source of income.  Every week she is able to earn an average net income of P 1,000.00 which she uses for their daily needs and for the school expenses of her children.  

She would like to borrow a loan of PHP5,000 from the lenders. She will use the loan to purchase sacks of rice that she will then sell in their village.  She hopes that the lenders will grant her request.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy supplies of rice for her retailing business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
This is Wilma B., a 46 year old entrepreneur from Ascoville, Malaria, Caloocan City.  Her husband Nicomedes, 49, works overseas.  Wilma takes care of their two children.
 
Due to consistent consumer demand, Wilma embarked on selling electronic load credits  for mobile phones five years ago.  She used to only attend to her direct selling of cosmetics and apparels (which she still does).  She now earns more than P20,000
net income a month. 

Wilma applied for a new loan with the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in the amount of P12, 000.00 as additional capital for her businesses.  She wishes to establish branches in other areas.  



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
“A man with patience and sacrifices will land on success”, this is a word of encouragement shared by Adela, a resident of Poblacion, Diadi,Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Alfredo and they have been gifted with seven children, three boys and four girls.  They want them to finish their college education and have a bright future.  They endure hardships and difficulties to earn a living for the sake of their children.

Her husband is one of the village councilors and also works as a laborer while she works as a vendor of fruit shake and homemade bath soap in their village.  She started her business with a small capital investment and she now earns a net income of PHP 650.00 week. Since her business greatly helps with the family expenses, she wants to continue and improve it. Lack of capital has motivated her to ask for a financial loan amounting to PHP 5,000.00.  She will invest the loan to purchase more merchandise so that her business will grow.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Due to the hardships and difficulties of life, Evelyn and her husband, Dionisio, help each other to earn a living for their family and for their five children. They live harmoniously in the village of Poblacion, Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya. They aim to uplift their standard of living so that they are able to give their children a better future.

The common source of living in their village is farming. Evelyn and Dionisio till their parcel of land and their crops includes rice, vegetables and corn. Since harvesting takes a long time, Evelyn engaged herself in selling fish and vegetables in their village for additional income. As a fruit of her patience and sacrifices, she is able to earn a net income of P 3,000 a month.

Since her income is not enough to meet the needs of their family, Evelyn decided to ask for financial assistance of PHP 5,000 from Kiva lenders. This will be used to increase her products that will further result in an increase in income.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

She is glad that she is able to help her husband in providing for the needs of their children and hopes to further expand her business by borrowing a loan amount of PHP 5,000 to be used as additional capital for her retailing business.

Marina is a diligent businesswoman married to Elmer, who has worked as a family driver in Manila for seven years. They have two children, both of whom are studying. The couple joins hands to provide a better future for their children. The family lives in the village of Palattao, Naguilian, Isabela.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. texts.en:
Judith V., 49, from the village of San Pedro, is the married mother of four adult-aged children. To make a living, Judith owns and operates an aquaculture business whose main source of income comes primarily from harvesting and selling cultured oysters known as "talaba" in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP per month.

In 2007, Judith joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 14,500 PHP from PMPC. she is requesting a new loan of 14,500 PHP to purchase materials needed to culture more oysters. This loan will be the her sixth from PMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

With her need for additional business capital, Benilda would like to request a loan of PHP 3,000 from Kiva lenders. This amount will really help to improve her hog-raising business by purchasing a feed supply.

She hopes that, through the assistance of the lenders, she will increase her income. She hope to maintain their good family relationship and live a progressive life.

texts.en:
Elizabeth C. is from the village of San Pedro. She is 52 years old. Elizabeth is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns and runs a tailoring business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general alteration and tailoring services to community members. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over 17 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Elizabeth joined PMPC in order to gain access to financial services that could help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fabrics and materials to produce more products. Elizabeth is currently requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP to be used for the same purpose. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Elizabeth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina manages a sari-sari store (community based store) in their village. She is married to Aldrin and their family resides in the village of Poblacion, Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya. They have six children; the eldest is now in second year high school, while the others are in elementary level.  Gina wants them to finish their studies in college so that they will find a good jobs in the future. 

Gina and her husband are doing their best to earn a living and support the schooling of their children. She usually purchase her products in the public market of Solano. Every week, she can earn a gross income of P 1,500.00 which she uses to acquire their daily basic needs and finance the schooling of their children. Since education nowadays is very costly, she needs to earn more income to finance the schooling of their children. To improve her business, she is now asking for a loan amounting to PHP5,000.  She is hoping that the more products she will sell, the more income she will earn.

loans.use: Additional capital in the improvement of her small variety store

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth B. is a new member of a KIVA field partner in the Philippines, ASHI. Through ASHI she requested a loan to start up a business that will change her family’s way of living. Through the profits she will be making, she hopes to send three out of four of her children to school until their graduation from college. Presently the range of her children’s age is from 10 to 21 years old.

Although Elizabeth felt quite disappointed with her eldest child who didn't finish her schooling after high school, she has not stopped dreaming for the rest of her children. Her disappointment has led her to work harder for to increase her family’s income. The food market business she plans to put up will be her means to augment her husband’s sporadic income as a farm laborer.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of sugar which she will market in their village

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is 44 years old, married and a mother to four children. She has been engaged in the hog raising business for six years and this has been a great help in sending her children to school.  Aside from raising her hogs, she is also helping her husband in managing their farm and occasionally she works on other farmers land to earn PHP100.00 a day in additional income.  

Aurelia lacks business capital for the maintenance of her business.  In this regard, she would like to borrow a loan from the KIVA lenders in the amount of PHP3,000 that will be used to purchase sufficient supplies of feed for her hogs.  She hopes that her business will continue to grow for the benefit of  her family.
