To make a living, Anita owns & operates a business in the retail sector. Her main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling green bananas to local buyers. Anita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Anita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. Anita is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase supplies for resale. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Anita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase supplies of green bananas for retail sale

loans.name: Judice Kwamboka

texts.en:
Judice is married to Wilfred, and they have one child, Kevin who is four years old. Judice was introduced to KADET through existing clients and she has no previous credit history. She has been in the computer service business for three years. Judice also owns rental houses that she rents and from which she receives additional income.

Judice will use her loan to renovate the rental homes that she has so that she can increase rents and therefore increase the return on her investment. Both of her businesses are in a slum. With the extra profits she earns, she plans to buy more computers for her computer service business. In the future Judice hopes to start a computer training college.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: The loan will be used to renovaterental rental houses.

loans.name: Peter Ndungu

texts.en:
Peter is married to Regina and they have three children: Eric, Joyce and Antony.

Peter was introduced to KADET through existing clients and he is servicing his third loan from KADET. He has no bad credit history. He has been in the business of selling green vegetables and groceries for five years. He intends to use this loan to increase his stock.

His area of business is in a slum area. It is a rather crowded place and the residents of the slum that are his clients. With the extra profits he makes, Peter plans to open a cereal shop. His hopes are to finish educating his children. He believes that he is persistent. 

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To increase his inventory green vegetables and groceries to sell

loans.name: Sin's Group

texts.en: Mr. Sin S. is a farmer with a 1 acre field in which he grows rice. His fields are now infertile, and he cannot grow any more rice. He is taking out this loan so he will be able to purchase fertilizer to be able to grow rice on his only field. He has a wife who is fifty years and two children, one a monk and one who is in school. His wife sells cakes, candy and other food in the local school where their son attends. They live in the Damnak village in Takeo province.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles T. is a single young man, born in 1988. He lives in Marigat Town, in the Rift-Valley Province of Kenya.  This is his third loan with KADET. His previous loans have been worth Kshs 80,000 and Kshs 30,000.

Charles Torotich runs a wholesale store in Marigat Town. He started in the wholesale business two years ago. His sells cooking oil, detergents and foodstuffs in his shop. Charles gets a profit of Kshs 20,000 every month from the wholesale business. He gets additional income from running a posho mill which is in the same town as his wholesale business.

Charles' business is situated within the residential estates of Marigat with a variety of customers ranging from small shops, hotels and supermarkets. This loan will be used to increase the stock in his shop.

If this loan boosts his business, Charles plans to buy a plot of land on which he will build a business structure so that he will not pay rent anymore, thus maximizing his profits. He dreams of expanding his business beyond Marigat and purchasing a lorry for easy and efficient transportation of goods.

He describes himself as a passionate business man who is focused on achieving set targets and future dreams.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To increase supplies for his wholesale business (items such as cooking oil, detergents, food)

loans.name: Lola

texts.en: Lola is 59 years old and she has 4 children. She sells mattresses and pillows in her community in Lagos state, Nigeria. She is a hard working woman and her shop is open from Mondays to Saturdays. Lola loves this business. Her customers pay cash when they come to purchase her goods and this has enabled her to expand her business. She has requested the loan amount of N170,000 to purchase more mattresses and pillows to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more mattresses and pillows to sell

loans.name: Annet's Group

texts.en: N. Annet is the leader of her lending group in Ibanda. She is 32 years old and married with 4 children.  She also takes care of other dependents. Annet is a determined and hard working businesswoman with a salon in Rwanyamuzira that she has been running for 8 years. She is able to make 150,000 shillings in profits a month, and she would like this to increase in the future. Annet says that her good customer care skills, in addition to the loans that help her restock, have helped her a great deal in growing her business. She dreams of expanding it further, and of having a stable family. Annet needs a loan to help buy more salon equipment like a drier, combs, hair extensions and chemicals.  These products will help her to provide quality services.

loans.use: to purchase salon equipment

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda D., 44 years old, is a rice grower in Kapatungan, Trento, Agusan Del Sur. She learned all the farming work from her parents and husband. She dreams that someday she will be able to grow her harvest to support the growing needs of their family. The income she makes from growing rice is what she uses to pay the daily expenses in their family including food, clothes and other basic needs.

Merlinda would like to apply for a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI). She will use the loan to finance her business by buying all the farming necessities. She chose CEVI because, aside from the 2% interest rate, it also provides insurance coverage to all its clients.

loans.use: To use for farm financing

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: Remedios Y. is from the city of Dao, Pagadian City. She is 45 years old, is married, and has two adult children. Remedios owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling specialty food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month. Remedios joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Remedios is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor R., 39 years old, is a rice farmer. He just harvested his farm, and now he is busy again preparing the farm for the next planting. In addition to rice, he also raises ducks; there are 500 ducks on his farm. When he is not busy tilling the farm, he turns all his attention to his ducks. His wife also helps him manage their business and they work together to provide their children with a better living.

Nestor needs additional capital again to run his business. The loan will help him buy farming necessities to grow his harvest and to increase the size of his duck farm.

loans.use: To use for farm financing

loans.name: Josiah

texts.en:
Josiah rears pigs. He lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo State, Nigeria. He is 56 years old and married with four children. He has been in this business for over 23 years and has been in LAPO, a Kiva partner, for the past two years. 

Josiah hopes for a loan of 50,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more piglets to rear and sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets to sell

loans.name: Kayode

texts.en:
Kayode sells drinks of different kinds. He lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo state, Nigeria. He is 38 and married with seven children. Kayode has been in this business for over 16 years because he loves selling drinks. He assists his family with part of his profit. 

Kayode hopes for a loan of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more drinks and a generator to cool drinks. With this, he will attract more customers and meet their demand. He is grateful to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and a generator for cool drinks

loans.name: Simplicia

texts.en:
Simplicia C. is from the village of Zone 2 San Simon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 49 years old. Simplicia is married and has 10 school-aged children. To make a living, Simplicia raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Simplicia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2007, Simplicia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Simplicia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. Simplicia is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Simplicia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future

location.town: San Simon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy N. is from the city of Pagadian City. She is 42 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Mercy owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month. Mercy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from PMPC. Mercy is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: Violeta N. is from the village of Cabuan, Guinsiliban Camiguin Province. She is 43 years old, is separated from her spouse, and has six school-aged children. Violeta owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling a variety of specialty foods in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Violeta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. Violeta is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en:
You can see from the photo that this is a young man who is enjoying his business. Ilham was born in 1976. He is single and lives in Fuzuli region.

Five years ago, Ilham started a cattle breeding business. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy four calves to improve his cattle-breeding business.

loans.use: To buy four calves

loans.name: Oun

texts.en: Mrs. Oun S. lives in the village of Sophy in Takeo province. She makes wine with rice to sell and also breeds pigs to earn income. Since her pig breeding business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing five more piglets and pig food. She also would use the rest of the requested loan to buy a cow for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Sok Phorn, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land and cultivate rices. Aside from this plantation, he is a motorbike taxi driver. Mrs. Oun S. is 34 years old and the mother of three children: two of whom are attending the local school, while the youngest is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To purchase piglets, pig food and a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Bukky

texts.en: Bukky sells electrical goods to make a living. She has been in this business for three years.  She is 31 years old and married with two children. She is a hard working woman and she is determined to lift her business high above poverty. She sells her electrical goods daily from 8am-6:30pm. She hopes for a loan of N170,000 to purchase more electrical goods to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more electrical goods to sell

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is 36 years old. She is married with four children. Currently all her children are in school. She produces Alata Samina, which is a locally made soap. It is widely used by many people in Ghana. Alata Samina is prepared from palm kernel oil and burnt cocoa pod. Due to the increase in cost of cocoa pods in the country, she is not able to buy more and therefore is requesting a loan to buy more raw materials. She hopes to raise her income and use the proceeds to employ more people to help her produce her soap and also support her kids in school.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials like palm kernel, cocoa pod etc.

loans.name: Mèhou Florence

texts.fr: H. Mèhou Florence est née le 16/03/1980 à Cotonou, Capitale économique du Bénin. Florence est mariée à DOSSOU Rogatien, un commerçant. Florence et Rogatien ont trois enfants tous scolarisés et encore à leur charge. La famille vit à Cocotomey, non loin de Cotonou. Florence et Rogatien assurent ensemble les charges de la famille. Florence a fait seulement le cours primaire. C'est plutôt la coiffure que Florence a fini par apprendre. Florence à son salon de coiffure à Godomey toujours non loin de Cotonou. En plus de la coiffure que Florence fait, elle vend également des produits de cheveux et de beauté. C'est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Florence s'approvisionne en ces différents produits. Florence veut pouvoir mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, c'est pourquoi Florence sollicite un prêt de ALIDé pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
H. Mèhou Florence was born on March 16, 1980 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to DOSSOU Rogatien, a merchant. She and Rogatien have three children who are all in school and still in their care. The family lives in Cocotomey, not far from Cotonou. Florence and Rogatien jointly ensure that family expenses are covered. Florence has attended only primary school. She sooner ended up learning about hairdressing. She has a hair salon in Godomey, which is also not far from Cotonou. In addition to working at hairdressing, she also sells hair products and beauty products. Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin, is where she stocks up on these different products. Florence wants to be able to respond better to the demands of her customers. This is why she’s requesting an ALIDé loan for bolstering her working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a dozen boxes of beautyproducts and ten dozen hair extensions

loans.name: Phally

texts.en: Phally N. lives in Ang Ta Kout village, in Takeo province. She is a farmer who cultivates rice on her own plot of land. She also breeders pigs. She wants to expand her pig raising business by purchasing ten piglets and pig food. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's lives with this loan. Em Sambath, Phally's husband is a teacher in a local school.  Phally is 45 years old and the mother of three children.  One is employed in a garment factory and the others attend school. Her husband is shown in the picture with Phally.

loans.use: Purchasing ten piglets and pig food for breeding.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana is a businesswoman. She trades in Dumas clothes, linen and lace materials. She sometimes sells through hawking, meaning she uses the personal selling method. This, she said, makes her goods move very fast.  She is 25 years old and a married mother with one child. She supports her family with the proceeds she makes from the business. She has four years of selling experience but progress has persistently been low due to insufficient funds. She hopes the loan will enable her to revive the business and make a profit that is more viable to sustain business. She wants to purchase Dumas clothes, linen and lace materials in bulk to increase her inventory. It is her desire to save more to give her child a better education.

loans.use: To purchase Dumas clothes in bulk

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe E. is from the village of Grace Village, Sto.Nino, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 35 years old. Fe is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Fe sells dried fish in the local community. Fe has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Fe from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 58 years old.  She is widowed and the mother of six children. Two of her children are in school. She always works hard to meet her target. By doing that, she has acquired lots of marketing and selling experience. She is a food vendor and prepares ‘Akyeke’ in front of her house. Akyeke is a local food with its origin from Cote’ de l‘voire in the west Africa region. Grace is the first to start Akyeke preparation in her community, which has seen high patronage. It is prepared from cassava and goes through many processes. With her 25 years of experience, she requests a loan to buy stock such as tomatoes, onions, pepper, cassava etc. She takes delivery of goods from the surrounding villages to prepare her food. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy food items like cabbage, tomatoes, onions, pepper and cassava etc.

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en: Sunday is 36 years old and married with five children.  He lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo state, Nigeria where he sells drinks and he has been in this business for over two years. Sunday is soliciting a loan of 50,000 to purchase more drinks. Sunday says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks

loans.name: Muzaffar

texts.ru: Музаффар Бобохонов проживает в Яванском районе. Возраст 43 года. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Сын находится на заработках в России. Музаффар имеет среднее образование. Он более 10 лет занимается животноводством. Клиент откармливает и продает скот. В данный момент он просит кредит, для покупки коровы, чтобы в дальнейшем продавать односельчанам молоко.
texts.en:
Muzaffar B. lives in the Yavan district. He is 43 years old, married and has 6 children. His son works in Russia. Muzaffar has secondary education. He has been involved in animal husbandry for over 10 years. He raises and sells livestock. Currently, he is requesting a loan in order to purchase a cow, so that he sell milk to his village neighbors in the future.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a cow

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is 45 years old and married with four children. She sells frozen foods like chicken, turkey, beef and fish. She is a hard working woman and she opens her stall daily to enable her to meet the demands of her customers. She hopes for a loan of N150,000 to purchase more frozen foods to sell. This is the high season for the sales of frozen foods and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Sim Chhit Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The Village Bank loA. consists of sixteen people and they all live in Phngeas village in Takeo province. Sim C., a village chief, is president and was selected by the members. His wife, Nat Nhorn is a rice farmer who owns a plot of land. She faces a problem because her field is infertile. Sim C. decided to ask for a loA. to buy fertilizers to renew the field.

Chanthorn U., who is sharing in the loA. is not present in the photo.  Her husband is pictured.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer to support the field to make a crop more productive.

loans.name: Foluke

texts.en: Foluke sells fish in Ogbomoso, Oyo State, Nigeria, where she resides. Foluke is married with five children. She is 39 years old. Foluke has been in LAPO for over two years and in her business for the past three years. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 to purchase more fish to meet the high demand of her customers. Foluke says a big thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fish.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia is a 50-year-old woman. She is a widow and the mother of two children. She is a food vendor who sells kenkey in her neighborhood. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers since many people enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch and supper. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to raise more income to help her first child enter the university.

loans.use: To purchase maize and other ingredients.

loans.name: Olabisi

texts.en: Olabisi sells foodstuffs and crates of eggs at retail prices to her customers in Lagos state, Nigeria. She has been in the business for a long time. She hopes for a loan of N150,000 to purchase more crates of eggs and foodstuffs to sell. She is 40 years old and married with five children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of eggs and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 30 years old, is married, and is the mother of three children, two of whom are in school right now. She always works hard to meet her target and, through that, she has acquired lots of marketing and selling experience.

Victoria is a trader and sells vegetables and spices like cabbages, tomatoes, onions, peppers, etc. She sells her goods on a table in the community market. She takes delivery of goods from the surrounding villages and retails them to her customers. 

Victoria is requesting the loan to buy lots of produce to upgrade her stock. She dreams of saving more and taking care of her children’s educational needs.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to upgrade her stock

loans.name: Bahram

texts.en:
Bahram is 41 years old and lives in Fuzuli region. He is married and has two children.

Bahram plays clarinet at weddings and has been in this business for five years. Now, he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to improve his business.

loans.use: To improve his business

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys sells dry fish and fresh tomatoes. Dry fish is very suitable for the preparation of fish meals, soup and sauces. Gladys is 53 years old and married with five children who are currently in school. She obtains her supply from big-time fishmongers. She wants to use this loan to buy dry fish and vegetables in bulk to meet the daily demands of her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to pay her children’s educational fees.

loans.use: To purchase assorted fish

loans.name: Tochidin

texts.ru: Бобоханов Точидин проживает в Яванском районе. Возраст 47 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Точидин имеет среднее образование. Он более 3 лет занимается животноводством. Он в основном продает дойное молоко своим односельчанам. Кредит просит для покупки скота, его откармливания и дальнейшей продажи.
texts.en:
Tochidin B. lives in the Yavan district. He is 47 years old, married and has 5 children. Tochidin has secondary education. He has been involved in animal husbandry for over 3 years. He mainly sells milk to his village neighbors. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of livestock, its feeding and subsequent sale.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Fuseini

texts.en: Fuseini sells porridge in her neighborhood. She is 45 years old, married and has given birth to seven children. Five of her children are in school. Porridge is one of the local foods enjoyed popularly as breakfast by almost all Ghanaians. It is prepared from milled maize or millet grains, boiled and served with sugar, milk and bread or eaten with kose. Kose is prepared from milled beans and it is fried with cooking oil so, in just about 20 minutes, it is ready to be served with the porridge. With her large customer base, Fuseini wants to use this loan to buy more raw materials like bags of millet, beans, sugar and milk to increase production. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, millet, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is a local manufacturer of palm kernel oil. She is 63 years old and a wife and mother of seven children. 
Palm kernel oil is produced from palm kernel. The palm kernel is a by-product of palm oil. The palm kernel is processed through various stages to obtain the palm kernel oil which is used to prepare many local dishes like fried fish and pastries. 
Georgina supplies food vendors for their meal preparation. However, her production is on the low side as a result of too little working capital to afford a processing machine. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of palm kernel and an electric milling machine to reduce the drudgery and manual effort required to produce larger quantities. She believes this loan will enable her to save more toward her child’s education.

loans.use: To purchase palm kernel in bulk and an electric milling machine

loans.name: Seng Meas Village Bank Group

texts.en: Seventeen people, who live in Dak Por village, Takeo province, make up the village bank loan. Seng M. is the group's president.  Each member is using their portion of the loan for different purposes. Seng breeds pigs and chickens and requests a loan to buy more piglets, chickens, and for construction materials. Her husband, Kouv Oub, is a rice and vegetable farmer who owns a piece of land. Seng is 51 years old and the mother of seven children, two of whom attend the local school.

loans.use: Various purposes.

loans.name: Lukaia

texts.en: Lukaia is 32 years old, a wife and mother of four kids. Three of them are currently in school. She operates a clothing shop and has been selling jeans, clothes, blouses, skirts, women's slippers, dressing bags and headscarves for the past eight years. Lukaia is constrained by funds to run the business. She needs the loan to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. She believes that the loan will help her to be more resourced to purchase good quality and large quantity to upgrade her inventory. She wants to use the loan to purchase jeans, clothes, ladieswear, headscarves and slippers.

loans.use: To purchase jeans, clothes, ladieswear and slippers

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is 21 years old, he is single and has one child. He is a very hardworking young chap. He dropped out of school because his parents did not have enough money to cater for his education. He had to take life into his own hands to make a living. He sells gari grains in bulk. Gari is prepared from milled cassava. He takes delivery of stock from the nearby communities to distribute, and treks to Cote’ de’Ivoire in the western part of Africa. He has a large customer base but his problem is not having adequate funds to buy stock. With the loan assistance, he believes he can be fully resourced to realized his dreams. He hopes that four years from now he can bring a total change to his family and improve his living conditions. Ibrahim would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy gari grains.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa is 30 years old, married and the mother of four children. She is a very hardworking woman who works hard to provide for her children. Two of her children are currently in school. She lives with her family in the area of the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. She sells gari grains in bulk in the market. Gari is prepared from milled cassava. She takes delivery of stock from the nearby communities and distributes, or sells during market days. She has a large customer base but her problem has to do with not having adequate funds to buy stock. With the loan assistance, she believes she can be fully resourced to realized her dream of providing education for her children.

loans.use: To buy gari grains.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua is 40 years old. She is married and the mother of six children. Currently all six children are in school. She lives with her husband, who is a businessman. Her family is doing very well and she is so happy about that. 

She is in the service industry, sewing dresses and clothing materials. She has been sewing for 15 years with 10 apprentices. She is a specialist in women's wear. Her skills and designs are of a good class. She sews various kinds of styles that give her customers a new look, like children's school uniforms, church attire, kaba and slit (a long skirt with a tailored top), wedding dresses, funeral clothes, etc. 

She wants to use the loan to buy supplies of sewing materials like linen, threads, thimbles, etc., to increase her output and efficiency. She hopes to increase her savings to provide her children with a quality education. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy supplies of sewing materials like linen, threads, thimbles, etc., to increase efficiency

loans.name: Suzan Namukasa’S Group

texts.en:
Susan is a 30-year-old married woman with six children between the ages of 4 and 16.  All her school go to school. She resides in and owns a three-roomed house, where she is staying with eight people. The family has access to electricity but no piped water. 

She owns a retail shop, where she sells all day-to-day essentials. She pays for transport costs to and from where she buys her merchandise in Kikuubo, one of the busiest places in Kampala. On average she receives 20 customers a day. She works in the outskirts of Kampala. She has been in this business for six years and with MCDT for 10 years. She is servicing her 17th loan, working with the same group mates. 

Her monthly expenses include school fees and medication. Her challenges include defaulters and the rainy season, because when it rains, very few customers come to her retail shop because it is in a muddy place. Susan wants to use this loan to buy more merchandise like boxes of soap, cartons of salt, sacks of sugar and jerrycans of cooking oil. She aspires to see her business grow stronger and to start selling only on a wholesale basis.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of soap, cartoons of salt and bags of sugar

loans.name: Mohammad Rahoof

texts.en:
The man who is pictured is Mohammad Rahoof the son of A. M.. He is 40, married, and the father of five children: three sons and two daughters. His youngest son is a first year college student and the others are students at school.

A. Rahoof owns a small retail shop and has the responsibility of paying for all the household expenses. Besides that, he has to pay the school fees and expenses of his children.

A. Rahoof has taken the decision to construct a new house because, after coming from Pakistan, they live in a rental house and that is really difficult for them to pay 5,000 Afghani which equals approximately 100 American dollars.

When he was informed about the loan process that is supporting the people, A. Rahoof came to AFS and requested an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani to purchase the essential construction materials to solve his problem.

A. Rahoof would like to thank both AFS and Kiva lenders that support the people around the world through their effective process.

loans.use: To purchasing construction materials to build his house

loans.name: Halimamo

texts.ru: Халимамо Абдулхаева проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст 22 года. Не замужем. Халимамо по специальности "педагог". Помимо этого она более года занимается животноводством. Она имеет дойную корову, молоко которой продает односельчанам. Т.к. имеется спрос на молоко клиентка хочет купить еще одну дойную корову, чье молоко также будет продавать односельчанам.
texts.en:
Halimamo A. lives in the city of Kulob. She is 22 years old and single. Halimamo is a teacher by trade. Besides this, she has been involved in animal husbandry for over a year. She owns a dairy cow and sells the milk to her village neighbors. Because there is a demand for milk, our client wants to purchase one more dairy cow, whose milk she would also sell to the villagers.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en:
Florence T. is the leader of her lending group in Bushenyi. She is a 39-year-old married woman with five children. Her children are between the ages of 7 and 17 years old, and she takes care of three orphans.

For the past five years, Florence has been engaged in the business of running a restaurant/hotel in Rweibare III. By doing so, she is able to earn approximately 200,000 UGX of profit per week. If Florence had had additional capital, she claims that she would have generated more profit because of her strategic positioning. Due to limited capital, she lacks funding to purchase additional food stuffs and restaurant materials (e.g., plates, cups, spoons, folks, and chairs).

In the future, Florence would like to expand her restaurant, and she would like for all of her children to be educated at the university level. As such, Florence is seeking a loan to help her build a new building for her restaurant. She explains that loans have always enabled her to buy enough food for her customers.

loans.use: To build a new (and improved/expanded) restaurant

loans.name: Alima

texts.en:
Alima is 45 years old. She is married and the mother of four children. All of her children are in school. She lives with her husband, who is a farmer, and their children in a small community in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. She is a food vendor. She has sold kenkey with fried fish for four years. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers since many Ghanaians enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch and supper. 

She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children's education. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana is 32 years old, married and a mother of four kids. All her children attend school in the community where she lives with the husband and the children. Her husband, she said is very supportive in helping her take care of the kids. Diana is a food vendor who sells kenkey in her neighborhood. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers since many Ghanaian enjoy kenkey as a breakfast, lunch and supper. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to raise more income to support her children especially with their education.

loans.use: To buy more supplies of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood for resale

loans.name: Oladoku

texts.en:
Oladoku is a 30-year-old married woman with four children. She lives in Oyo State, Nigeria.

For the past eight years, she has been in the business of selling various provisions. She is now requesting a loan in the amount of N50,000 ($350) to purchase additional provisions in order to meet the demands of her customer base and to expand her business. She expresses her deep gratitude to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To satisfy customer demand and to expand her business by purchasing additional goods

loans.name: Aidah

texts.en: Aidah is 37 years old and married with five children aged between 3 and 16 years.  All her children attend school. She resides and owns a four room house where she is staying with seven people. The family has access to electricity but no piped water.  She owns a stall selling bananas and doesn’t pay for transport costs to and from shopping as she buys from the very market where she works.  On average she receives about 20 customers a day. She works in the out skirts of Kampala. She has been in this business for ten years and with MCDT for eight years ,servicing her seventeenth loan, working with the same group mates. Her monthly expenses include school fees and medication. Her challenges include defaulters and rainy season because when it rains very few customers come to her stall because it is in muddy place. Aidah wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas. She aspires to see her business grow stronger and wants to start buying from farmers directly.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas for resale

loans.name: Armande Louise

texts.fr: N. Armande Louise est née le 24/08/1976 à Cotonou, Capitale économique du Bénin. Armande Louise est mariée à DJIKPETO Luc, un transitaire. Armande Louise et Luc ont trois enfants, tous scolarisés et encore à leur charge. La famille vit à Cocoomey, non loin de Cotonou. Armande Louise et Luc assurent ensemble les charges de la famille. Armande Louise a fait le cours secondaire mais c'est la coiffure que Armande Louise a fini par apprendre. Armande Louise a son salon de coiffure à Cocotomey et y vend également des produits de cheveux et de beauté. C'est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Armande Louise s'approvisionne en ces différents produits. Armande Louise a besoin de moyens financiers pour agrandir son salon, c’est pourquoi elle sollicite un prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Armande Louise N. was born on August 24, 1976 in Cotonou, the capital city of Benin. Armande Louise is married to Luc Djikpeto, a driver. Armand Louise and Luc have three children, and they are all going to school and they are all still in their care. The family lives in Cocotomey, not far from Cotonou. Armande Louise and Luc are both responsible for the family’s wellbeing. Armande Louise finished high school but it’s hairdressing that she ended up studying. Armande Louise has a beauty shop in Cocotomey and she also sells beauty products and hair care products. In Dantokpa, the large international market in Benin, Armande Louise buys all her different products. Armande Louise requires funds to expand her salon, which is the reason why she is requesting a loan of Alide (Kiva Field Partner).


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic and beauty products.

loans.name: Dolapo

texts.en:
Dolapo is a 35-year-old married woman with four children. She lives in Oyo State, Nigeria.

To earn a living, she sells various foods, such as steamed beans and bean cakes. She is now requesting a loan in the amount of N100,000 ($675) to increase her inventory; specifically, she would like to purchase additional beans, oil, and eggs. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their continued support.

loans.use: To expand her inventory by purchasing additional items (e.g., beans, oil, and eggs)

loans.name: Lorina

texts.en:
Lorina C. is from the village of Don Jose Aguirre. She is 32 years old. Lorina is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Lorina owns & operates a business in the retail sector running a general store. Her main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Lorina has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lorina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Lorina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Lorina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet is 29 year old and married with three children aged between 3 and 11 years. All her children go to school. She resides and owns a four roomhouse where she is staying with seven people .The family has access to electricity but no piped water.  She owns a stall selling bananas and doesn’t pay for transport costs to and from shopping as she buys from the very market where she works.  On average she receives about 20 customers a day. She works in the out skirts of Kampala. She has been in this business  for eight years and with MCDT for nine years. She is servicing her seventeenth loan, working with the same group mates. Her monthly expenses include school fees and medication. Her challenges include defaulters and rainy season. Annet wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas. She aspires to see her business grow stronger and to start going to farmers directly.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Mercidita

texts.en:
Mercidita B. is from the village of Del Pilar, Baliangao Mis. Occidental. She is 48 years old. Mercidita is married and has four school-age children. To make a living, Mercidita owns and operates a business which makes and sells bread in the local community. 

In 2006, Mercidita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercidita has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC.  She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used for additional capital for her existing business. This loan will be the 3rd cycle loan taken out by Mercidita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for her existing business

loans.name: Prudence M. Mondoukpè

texts.fr: K. Prudence M. Mondoukpè est née le 06/05/1976 à Porto-Novo, Capitale administrative du Bénin. Prudence est mariée à GANLAKI Blanchard, un transitaire. Prudence et Blanchard ont trois enfants, tous scolarisés et encore à leur charge. La famille vit à Cocotomey, non loin de Cotonou. C’est le mari de Prudence qui assure les charges de la famille. Ce qui permet à Prudence d’investir les revenus de son activité dans celle-ci pour mieux la développer. Prudence vend dans sa boutique sise à Cocotomey des divers (liqueurs, boîtes de conserve, amuses gueule, papiers hygiéniques, bougies, piles, produits de beauté, boissons en Cannet, sucre, etc.).  Pour renforcer son fonds de roulement dans l’optique de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Prudence sollicite un crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Prudence M. Mondoukpè K. was born on 6 May 1976 in Porto Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. Prudence is married to Blanchard Ganlaki, a freight agent. Prudence and Blanchard have three children, all of whom are in school and still in the care of their parents. The family lives in Cocotomey, not far from Cotonou. It is Prudence's husband who provides for the family. This allows Prudence to invest her income in her business to better develop it. In her store located in Cocotomey, Prudence sells various items (liquor, canned goods, snacks, toilet paper, candles, batteries, cosmetics, Cannet drinks, sugar, etc.). To strengthen her working capital with the goal of better responding to her customers' demands, Prudence is seeking a loan through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners).

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 10 boxes of canned goods, 20 boxes of Cannet drinks, and boxes of sugar

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en: Mrs. Virgilia C. is from the village of Magsaysay, Baliangao Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old, married, and blessed with seven adult children. She owns and operates a business venture in the agricultural sector raising crops. She has been engaged in her business for more than 20 years. Her monthly net income from her business is 2,500. She joined PMPC on April 1, 2001 to access their programs and services. Currently, she's requesting her 14th cycle loan in the amount of 14,900 for the purpose of obtaining additional capital for her business.

loans.use: Capital for buying fertilizer

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: Afia is a 45-year-old woman. She is married and a mother of five kids. Four of her children are in school in their local community. Her husband, she says, is very supportive in helping her taking care of the kids. She is a food vendor and sells kenkey in her neighborhood. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and eaten with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers since many Ghanaian people enjoy kenkey for breakfast, lunch and supper. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to raise more income to support her children, especially in their education.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sewing materials like linen, thread, thimbles, etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is forty-four years old. She is married and has given birth to six children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a busy commercial and farming community in the Brong Ahafo Region called Goaso. She is a food vendor; more specifically, Mary runs a chop bar in her community. She buys foods such as cassava, plantains, etc. from nearby towns. She then prepares and sells all kinds of local dishes. Mary has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy foodstuffs and other ingredients in bulk so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: purchasing more foodstuffs

loans.name: Fuseini

texts.en: Fuseini is eighteen years old. He is single and currently lives with his older brother. He is a butcher in the community in which he lives. He gets his stock of meat wholesale and then sells it retail to his customers. He wants to use this loan to buy more meat, which should enable him to earn enough income to rent a single room apartment. He hopes to pay the loan back on time.

loans.use: purchasing more meat

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is thirty-nine years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, all of whom are in school. Monica lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a busy commercial and farming community in the Brong Ahafo Region called Goaso. She is a trader; more specifically, Monica trades in charcoal. She supplies charcoal to retailers and food vendors in her community. She also travels to other communities to supply them with charcoal. Monica buys her bags of charcoal from charcoal burners in nearby towns. Monica has been in business for eight years and wants a loan, which she will use to buy bags of charcoal in bulk.

loans.use: purchasing bags of charcoal

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en: Mariam is twenty-eight years old. She is single and currently lives in a single room apartment. She is a trader; more specifically, she trades in jeans, blouses, skirts, children's clothes, et cetera. She has been in business for the last year. Her working capital was provided by her friend, but it is not adequate for her business. She is no longer able to purchase high quality products. She believes that the loan will help her be able to purchase a lot of good quality merchandise, which in turn will lead to more sales. She wants to use the loan to purchase jeans, ladies wear and slippers to increase her inventory. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: purchasing jeans, ladies wear and slippers

loans.name: Rosemond

texts.en: Rosemond is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to six children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial and farming community in the Brong Ahafo Region called Goaso. Rosemond is a baker; more specifically, she bakes bread and then sells it to retailers and beverage sellers in her community. Rosemond also sells directly in her community. She buys her goods from Kumasi. Rosemond has been in business for five years and is requesting a loan, with which she will buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: purchasing bags of flour

loans.name: Shafiqullah

texts.en:
This is Shafiqullah, the 25-year-old son of M.. He lives in the 16th district of Kabul, Afghanistan. Despite the fact that he is so young, he has a great deal of responsibility to help care for his family members. He lives with his family, which consists of seven people, including his father and mother. He explains that he is the oldest son in his family.

Shafiqullah owns and operates a general store where he sells a variety of products. He is seeking a loan in the amount of 50,000 Afghani ($1,025) to purchase additional, high-quality materials for his shop. In fact, his ultimate goal as it pertains to this loan is to attract more clients and to be able to purchase products which are in high demand. In turn, he hopes to continue to make needed changes to his business. He is confident that he will repay this loan on time, and he expects to apply for a second loan soon after he fully repays this loan in the near future. He would like to extend his deep gratitude to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand and improve his business by purchasing additional, high-quality goods

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa is 48 years old, single, and committed to God and her business. She has been trading in Dumas clothing, blouses and skirts, women's underwear and bags, for the past year. Yaa has lots of experienced in trading, but inadequate funds for her business. She sells her goods through hawking in the community and other surrounding villages on their market days. Demand for her products is high but she is not able to purchase high quality products.

Yaa believes this loan give her the resources to purchase good quality items in large quantities in order to scale up sales. She wants to use the loan to purchase jeans, clothes and slippers, to increase her inventory. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To purchase jeans, womenswear and slippers

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is fifty years old. He is married and has seven children who are all in school. Joseph lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a busy commercial/farming community in the Brong Ahafo Region called Goaso. Joseph is a trader. For four years he has been trading in cereals – maize. He supplies to food vendors in his community and also sells at the market square. Joseph also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. He buys his goods from nearby towns. He is requesting a loan of $500 so he can buy larger quantities of maize in bulk and earn more profit for his efforts.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Make A Difference Group

texts.en:
Make A Difference is a group of 5 borrowers which is led by Mama K.. Mama is a 29-year-old married woman with three children. Her children are between the ages of 5 and 12 years old, and their educational levels are between first and fifth grades. Unfortunately, due to poverty, she is illiterate. Mama and her family live in northern Liberia in Ziggida, a small town close to Zorzor, a district in Lofa county.

Mama is engaged in the business of selling foodstuffs. More specifically, she buys goods such as seasonings, dry fish, cassava, and plantains at wholesale prices, and she then sells such goods at retail prices (for a profit) to local residents. She explains that she has been operating this business for 3 years and that she is hoping to expand to the point that she can purchase her own shop. Mama notes that she serves her customers with respect and talks to her customers in a courteous manner in order to encourage them to continue buying from her.

Mama and her family depend on the success of this business for their day-to-day needs. She has been facing financial difficulties as of late: for one thing, her business is not particularly large, so her profits do not fully cover her family's living expenses at this time; further, her husband is sick, so she is carrying the entire burden of providing for the family. Thus, she is seeking this loan in order to purchase more foodstuffs. Her ultimate dream is for her children to receive a quality education.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional foodstuffs (e.g., seasonings, cassava, plantains, and fish)

loans.name: Tetyana

texts.en: Tetyana is divorced with two adult children. She sells cups, plates, dishes and other kitchen items at the central open market in Beregovo. Tetyana has been in this business for eight years. She knows her clientele's needs and offers them quality products at reasonable prices. Her kiosk is located in a  high traffic place that brings many clients her way. Tetyana is a hard working, purpose driven and persistent person. She works hard to develop her business further. Tetyana is requesting a loan of $1,475 to purchase more inventory. This will help Tetyana to produce more income for herself and her family.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Rashidatu

texts.en:
Rashidatu sells crates of drinks at retail prices to her various customers within her community in Lagos State, Nigeria.

Rashidatu is 33 years old and she is married with two children. Her children attend a private school in Lagos State.

Rashidatu hopes for the loan of N150,000 to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is 46 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children who are all in school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial/farming community in the Brong Ahafo Region called Goaso. Margaret is a trader. She trades in textiles such as ladies’ under wears, infants’ layette, etc. She sells at the local market square and also treks to sell in other community markets. Margaret buys her goods from Kumasi. She has been in business for over twelve years and is requesting a loan of $700 to buy bales of textiles in bulk. Buying large quantities enable her to realize more profit for her efforts.

loans.use: To buy clothes in bulk

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda T. is from the village of Talisay. She is 35 years old. Florenda is single. To make a living, Florenda owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling cosmetic products in the local community. Florenda is just starting this business.

In 2006, Florenda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florenda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell in her existing sari-sari store. Florenda is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used as working capital and to purchase additional inventory for the new business venture. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Florenda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to cover the education expenditures of her sister.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Working capital, and to purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is 70 years old, a widowed mother with six children. Currently, her last born is in school, while the rest are independent. Ama sells frozen foods like chicken, pork, mutton, fish, meat, and sausages in the local market and has been in business for the last 15 years. She does not have adequate funds to support her business. This has affected her operation, especially in the face of increasing food prices. With the loan, she wants to purchase more cartons of frozen foods like fish, chicken, pork, and other meats to enable her to raise enough income to expand her sales. She also wants to use part of her profit to acquire additional freezers to stock her products. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy cartons of frozen foods like fish, chicken, mutton, etc.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn P. is from the village of Taboo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old. Rosalyn is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Rosalyn owns & operates a business venture in the food sector, selling fish. The main source of income for the business comes from selling fish to the local community. Rosalyn has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Rosalyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Rosalyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital to purchase fish to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Aline

texts.fr: Z. Aline est née vers 1982 à Tori-Bossito dans le Sud du Bénin. Aline est mariée à HOUNKPONOU C. Symphorien, un Directeur d’école. Aline et Symphorien ont trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge dont deux enfants sont les leurs. La famille vit à Cocotomey, non loin de Cotonou. C’est le mari de Aline qui assure les charges de la famille. Ce qui permet à Aline d’investir les revenus de son activité dans celle-ci. Aline vend en effet des divers (pâtes alimentaires, riz, boîtes de conserve, condiments de sauce, etc.). C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Aline s’approvisionne en ces différents produits. Aline veut agrandir sa boutique  pour mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. C’est pourquoi, Aline sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Aline Z. was born around 1982 in Tori-Bossito, in southern Benin. Aline is married to C. Symphorien Hounkponou, a school principal. Aline and Symphorien have three children in their care, all in school, and two of whom are their own. The family lives in Cocotomey, not far from Cotonou. It is Aline's husband who provides for the family. This allows Aline to invest her income back into her own business. Aline sells various items (food pastes, rice, canned food, sauce condiments, etc.). It is at Dantokpa, Benin's grand international market, that Aline obtains supplies of these various products. Aline wants to enlarge her store to better respond to the demands of her clientele. This is why Aline is seeking financial support through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners).

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy baskets of tomatoes and onions, boxes of food paste, and boxes of canned goods

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is 58 years old. She is widowed and has seven children, who are fully independent. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skimmed powdered milk, and biscuits in her neighborhood. With the loan, she wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits, etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve her savings to support her business growth. She has five years of experience in selling goods and hopes to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of bottled mineral water, boxes of biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Maiya Devi

texts.en:
Maiya Devi A. is a 39-year-old woman who lives in Bhakepati, Kathmandu. She lives in a single family with her husband and three children. Her husband, Mr. Ram Krishna A., works in a grocery store. All her children are now studying in higher secondary school.

Mrs. A. opened her mo:mo (Chinese food) shop a few years ago to uplift the living standard of her family. In Nepal, mo:mo is very famous. So the demand for mo:mo is rising constantly.

Now Mrs. A. is requesting a loan of 30,000 NPR to buy cooking materials to use for making mo:mo.

loans.use: To buy cooking materials for her work

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 39 years old and she is married without children. She produces and sells ice blocks at retail prices to her customers. She is a friendly and happy woman and uses her friendly skills to attract more customers to her stall.

Betty hopes for the loan of N160,000 to purchase an ice-block-making machine to enable her to produce more ice blocks to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase an ice-block-making machine

loans.name: Olayinka

texts.en:
Olayinka is 40 years old and married with four children. She sells foodstuffs and drinks and assists her husband with part of her profit. She lives in Oyo State, Nigeria.

Olayinka is soliciting a loan of N80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is 41 years old, and is married with one child who has just completed senior high and is awaiting his results to enter tertiary education. She is a hardworking woman who trades in Ghanaian-made slippers, shoes and sandals for both men and women. Abena takes delivery of stock from Kumasi in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She purchases shoes in different sizes, colors and designs so that her customers can make their choice. She rents a stand in the market where she sells her footwear.

Abena has no regrets about the business because it has given her lots of experience in marketing and sales. She is requesting a loan to buy stock in bulk, and would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy Ghanaian footwear for retail

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda C. is from the village of San Pedro. She is 41 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Criselda owns and operates a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling cultured oyster products known as "talaba" in the local community. Criselda has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Criselda joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Criselda is requesting a new loan of 14,0000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her fifth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en:
Iyabo lives in Oyo State, Nigeria. She is married with 5 children. She is 40 years old.

Iyabo sells provisions and foodstuffs. She is soliciting a loan of N80,000 to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Bhawani

texts.en:
Bhawani B. is a resident of Bhatkepati, Lalitpur. She lives with her husband and three children – two sons and one daughter. Both her sons are studying in primary school and her daughter is in pre-primary school.

Both Mr. and Mrs. B. are engaged in poultry and agricultural farming. The couple opened their poultry farm two years ago. They buy all the small chickens and grain feed for the chickens from dealers. The poultry farm has been successful and they earn a good profit from it. Now they are seeking a 25,000 NPR loan to buy more small chickens to expand their business.

loans.use: To buy more small chickens

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is a 37-year-old married mother of five children, three of whom are in school. She is a food vendor who sells kenkey. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains and is taken with hot pepper or soup. Comfort has many customers since kenkey is enjoyed by many Ghanaians as breakfast, lunch and supper.

Comfort wants to use her loan to buy more raw materials, such as bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to be able to put aside some savings as an investment for the future.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials, such as maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is a 31-year-old woman. She is married and has three children: two are in school and her youngest is breastfeeding. She lives with her husband. Juliana is an achiever and a resourceful mother.  Juliana has been in the business of selling foodstuffs, like plantains, for ten years now and loves it. She treks to surrounding villages in the community to purchase bulk stock of plantains from the farmers and sells them retail to her customers. For lack of adequate working capital, she is not able to pick enough stock to make enough profit to support her family.  With the loan, she wants to purchase bulk supplies of plantains to enable her to scale up her business.

loans.use: To purchase plantains in bulk

loans.name: Women Of Today Group

texts.en:
Women Of Today is a group of 5 borrowers led by Korpo S.. Korpo is 38 years old and married. She has 6 children who are 12-18 years old and whose educational levels are 5th-12th grade. She is an illiterate due to poverty. Korpo and her family live in Ziggida Town, a small town close Zorzor, a district in Lofa county in northern Liberia.

Korpo’s business is selling palm oil. She buys palm oil wholesale and sells it at retail in bottles from a table to residents of Ziggida Town. She has been running this business for 3 years and is hoping to improve to a bigger table. Korpo sells quality palm oil and also takes good care of her customers during transactions in order encourage them to continue buying from her.

Korpo started this business with little funds, given to her by her husband because his small salary can’t take care of their home. She manages her little business and has turned it into something better, and she aims at growing to a bigger table.

She needs this loan in order to purchase more palm oil wholesale to earn more profits to improve her business. She dreams of giving her family the best of support and of changing their lives totally.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil to resell

loans.name: Servilla

texts.en:
Servilla S. is from the village of Owaon. She is 55 years old, married, and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Servilla owns and operates an agriculture business raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Servilla has been engaged in her business for more than 1 year and earns approximately PHP 1,700 a month.

In 2007, Servilla joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Servilla has successfully repaid a previous loan of PHP 11,000 from PMPC. Servilla is requesting a new loan of PHP 7,000, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Servilla from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Kwaku

texts.en: Kwaku, a 43-year-old trader, is married with five children. All his children are in school, from primary to junior high school. He is a very resourceful man who works hard to support his family.  He makes a living farming and selling used clothing. Secondhand clothing sales makes up a very big market share in Ghana, as brand new clothes are too expensive for the poor. Kwaku has been in this business for the past five years.  He travels to a nearby city called Kumasi to purchase his stock of goods. He wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothing to increase his inventory. He believes this loan would help him save for the future and expand his business.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothing

loans.name: Adzaratu

texts.en:
Adzaratu is thirty years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, all in school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Adzaratu works to help her husband financially to provide for the family. She is a petty trader. She trades in all kinds of cereals such as maize, beans, groundnuts, etc. She procures the goods from nearby communities. Adzaratu sells at the local market to food vendors and retailers. She has been in business for over twelve years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. She is hopeful to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia L. is from the village of Estrella, Sinacaban Mis. Occ.. She is 35 years old. Claudia is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Claudia owns and operates a "sari-sari" retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling products like shampoo, toothpaste, rice, sugar and other basic needs. Claudia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Claudia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Claudia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional goods to sell. Claudia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Claudia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
