texts.es: Doña Amparo de 56 años de edad, vive en Villa Venezuela en la capital de Managua, soltera y con cuatro hijos que procreo  los cuales son mayores de edad, y le apoyan económicamente, su oficio es la costura el cual aprendió desde joven y ha sido su medio de trabajo con la experiencia ha logrado coser fino, hacer modelos modernos, y captar su clientela, lleva 16 años en las costura el cual da gracias a Dios por que pudo criar a sus hijos y poderlo ver crecer ya que su costura la hace en su casa, hace sabanas, fundas con bordados, vestidos para niñas y vender a si como la costura que sus clientes llegan hacerse. Con este crédito invertirá en la compra de tela, bordados y aprovechar la temporada a si como hacer un pequeño inicio del muro para lograr mejor seguridad de su vivienda a muchos esfuerzo hizo su casa mitad piedra y tablas pero su casa propia que espera poder hacerla toda de concreto a futuro. Agradece a la institución por los beneficios que ha dado para prosperar en su costura.
texts.en:
Amparo is 56 years old and lives in the Villa Venezuela neighborhood in Managua. She is single and has four adult children who help support her economically. She works as a seamstress which she learned as a young girl. Through many years of experience she has learned how to sew high quality garments and modern styles and gained a clientele. She has 16 years experience sewing and thanks God that through this job she was able to raise her children and watch them grow up because she ran her business out of her home. She makes sheets, embroidered covers and pillowcases, dresses for girls, and other orders made by clients. With this loan she will purchase fabric and embroidery and take advantage of the season. With the profits she hopes to begin building a wall around her home to offer better security. Her home is currently made half of stone and half of wooden boards, but it is her own home and she hopes to build it with concrete in the future. She is thankful to the institution for the assistance and benefits she has received for her sewing business.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric and embroidery

loans.name: Mardely Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Mardely de 46 años de edad, se dedica a las ventas de cosméticos, y venta de refrescos, gaseosas, el cual inicio con dinero propio cuando vendió una camioneta de su propiedad, su esposo es conductor  de una empresa privacidad, procreo tres hijos dos trabajan y uno de 10 años cursa su primaria, su meta es poner una boutique en un punto centrar en donde pueda a traer el cliente, cuando no le pagan es cuando se bajan su capital, ya que se arriesga adar al crédito de quincena pero los clientes trabajan de esta manera, también desea poder mejorar su casa. Con este préstamo invertirá en la compra de cosméticos y frutas para hacer los ricos refrescos, ya que viene la mejor temporada del mes y es cuando se vende más. Da las gracias Afodenic por el apoyo con los créditos a plazo ya que se logra invertir en inventario.
texts.en:
Ms. Mardely is a 46-year-old woman who sells cosmetics and beverages for a living. She started her business with her own money that she received when she sold her van. Her husband is a driver for a private company. They have three children: two who work and a 10-year-old who is in elementary school. Her goal is to set up a boutique in a central point where she can attract more customers. Her working capital decreases when she does not get paid because she takes a risk by offering her goods on a biweekly credit, however, this is how her customers do business with her. She would also like to make home improvements. She will invest this loan in purchasing both cosmetics and the fruit that she needs to make her delicious drinks, this being her peak of the month when her products really sell. She gives thanks to Afodenic for supporting her with microloans in installments, thus allowing her to invest in inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruit to make drinks and purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Alihossi

texts.fr: Cette femme s’est lancée en 2002 dans la vente des produits d’alimentation générale ; parce que son mari a eu sa retraite et il fallait assurer l’éducation scolaire de leurs 05 enfants. C’est pour cette raison qu’elle avait prise cette décision. Elle exerce cette activité dans le quartier d’Adamavo à Lomé. Elle a ouvert une boutique dans sa maison et vend des pâtes alimentaires, des sardines, des tomates en boîtes, des mayonnaises et divers produits. Elle accueille bien sa clientèle et est très connue de plusieurs ménages. Elle a approché WAGES pour pouvoir renouveler son stock de marchandises en baisse. Le prêt lui permettra d’acheter 10 cartons de sardines, 15 cartons de tomates en boîtes, des savons, de l’huile de cuisine et des produits divers.
texts.en:
In 2002 this woman began selling general food products because her husband retired and she had to provide for the education of her 05 children. It is for this reason that she made this decision. She practices her profession in the Adamavo neighborhood in Lomé. She opened a store in her home and sells pasta, sardines, canned tomatoes, mayonnaise and various other products. She is very accommodating to her customers and is well known in several households. She approached WAGES in order to be able to replenish her stock of decreasing merchandise. This loan will allow her to purchase 10 boxes of sardines, 15 boxes of canned tomatoes, soap, kitchen oil, and various other products.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase general food products

loans.name: Nogaye

texts.fr:
Madame  Nogaye  D.  évolue  dans le commerce de tissus de légumes et d autres  produits divers depuis cinq ans .C est une femme mariée  avec deux enfants  et sa famille habite a Camberene une banlieue située au nord de Dakar. C est son premier crédit et elle emprunte un montant de 150 000 frs. Elle souhaite acheter des Guedj (poissons séchés) et autres produits divers pour élargir son marche. Avec ce crédit elle prévoit d augmenter ses revenus de 15.000 frs  mensuellement.

Madame NOGAYE D. est une bénéficiaire du protocole entre U-IMCEC et le Programme de Développement de l'infant et de la Famille (PDEF)  Seydina  Issa Laye.  Le PDEF cherche à réduire la pauvreté au sein de la communauté et surtout à protéger les enfants issus des familles démunies.  Grâce a cette coopération, les parentes de ces derniers peuvent profiter de crédit a des conditions plus souples par rapport aux crédits ordinaires.  Depuis le démarrage du protocole en Décembre 2008, 120 parents ont reçu un financement pour des montants qui varient entre 50.000 et 150.000 frs.
texts.en:
Ms. Noyage D. has been advancing for five years in her business selling vegetables and a variety of other goods. She is married and has two children. Her family lives in Camberene, a suburb located north of Dakar. This is her first loan, and she is borrowing the amount of 150,000 francs. She wishes to buy some guedj (dried fish) and various other goods to expand her market. With this loan, she is planning to increase her monthly revenues by 15,000 francs. Ms. NOGAYE D. is a beneficiary of the agreement between U-IMCEC and the Programme de développement de l'infant et de la famille (PDEF) Seydina Issa Laye. The PDEF seeks to reduce poverty within the community and especially to protect children who come from destitute families. Thanks to this cooperation, the parents of these children can take advantage of loans having more flexible terms compared to ordinary loans. Since the agreement’s kickoff in December 2008, there have been 120 parents who received financing in amounts varying from 50,000 to 150,000 francs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her market

loans.name: Fe Y Amor 6 & 7 Group

texts.en:
Yanira is a 36-year-old borrower who lives near La Romana, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for the group “Fe y Amor” (Faith and Love), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in her group.

The area around La Romana is dominated by the Dominican Republic’s vast sugar fields. Electricity is scarce and there is no access to potable water. Despite the difficulties of living in this area, Yanira successfully runs a small stand selling fruit and general household items. With this loan, she plans on buying various merchandise for her stand including fruit, flour, oil, and charcoal to sell to her friends and neighbors.

This is Yanira’s fifth loan with Esperanza International and, with a perfect repayment record so far, she hopes it will not be her last. She came to Esperanza in order to inject capital into her business and has been successful so far.

With the profits her loan brings, Yanira hopes to purchase her own home someday, even if it is simple. She also hopes to move her business into its own store, continually improving its appearance and offerings. Thank you for lending to Yanira and the Fe y Amor group!

loans.use: To buy fruit, other food, and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Olga Hortencia

texts.es:
LA SRA. OLGA HORTENCIA A. A., CASADA, TIENE 43 AÑOS DE EDAD Y 4 HIJOS,UNA MUJER EMPRENDEDORA QUE ADMINISTRA SU PROPIA IMPRENTA DE NOMBRE “OLGRAF”, Y  HA INCULCADO EN SUS HIJAS LOS DESEOS DE PROGRESO A BASE DE SU PROPIO TRABAJO Y ESFUERZO.
HACE  20 AÑOS, INICIÓ TRABAJANDO COMO VENDEDORA PARA UNA IMPRENTA, ECONOMICAMENTE NO CUBRÍA SUS ESPECTATIVAS, PERO ADQUIRIÓ MUCHA EXPERIENCIA Y LUEGO DE UN TIEMPO, EMPEZÓ A TRABAJAR INDEPENDIENTEMENTE LO CUAL  LE RESULTABA  MUY TRABAJOSO YA QUE TENÍA QUE ALQUILAR  MÁQUINAS PARA CUMPLIR CON EL TRABAJO.
HOY EN DÍA CUENTA CON UN LOCAL EN UNA ZONA MUY COMERCIAL, CON EQUIPOS PROPIOS, ADEMÁS CON SUS INGRESOS HA CUBIERTO LOS GASTOS DE ESTUDIOS SUPERIORES DE SUS HIJAS.
EL PRÉSTAMO SOLICITADO LO DESTINARÁ EN LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES PARA CUMPLIR CON UN PEDIDO DE LIBROS.
texts.en:
Olga Hortencia A. A. is married and is 43 years old. She has 4 children and is an entrepreneur who manages her own printing press named "Olgraf". She has instilled in her daughters' minds ideas of progress based on one's own work and effort. Twenty years ago, she began working as a salesperson for a printing press. Financially, she was unable to cover her expenses, but she gained a lot of experience. After some time, she started to work independently which made her very hardworking, given that she had to rent machines to carry out the work. Today, she has a shop in a commercial district with her own team. She has also covered her daughters' higher education costs with her income. She will use the loan that she is requesting to purchase materials to carry out a book order.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in materials for a book order

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is 35 years old. She is married and the mother of four children. All her children are in school currently. She loves selling goods, the business through which she obtains her daily source of livelihood. She has been selling corn and cassava dough for the last two years to support her family.

Corn and cassava dough are favorite staple foods that supply carbohydrate components in diets. Abena takes delivery of stock from farmers who provide her with direct supply. This enables her to avoid intermediaries who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices. With this loan, she wants to buy maize and cassava in bulk to serve her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her business expansion and pay for the children's education.

loans.use: To buy bulk stock of maize and cassava

loans.name: Donal Alberto

texts.es: Donal Alberto tiene 31 años, su actividad económica es la venta de ropa. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que con la ayuda de su esposa logro comenzar y juntos salían a las calle a ofrecer sus productos Donal consiguió adquirir experiencia necesaria para este negocio. Por lo que más tarde lograron establecerse en el mercado y juntos han logrado invertir todos los días en nuevos productos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será utilizado para la compra de cosmético, pantalones, camisas, faldas y calzado. El sueño de él es que sus hijos logren administrar el negocio y puedan salir adelante.
texts.en:
Donal Alberto is a 31-year-old man who sells clothing for a living. He has been in business for over 7 years. With the help of his wife, they would both hit the streets to sell their products. Donal managed to obtain the experience necessary for this type of business. Later on, he was able to get established in a local market. He and his wife have managed to invest in new products every day. The loan that he is requesting will be used to purchase cosmetics, pants, shirts, skirts, and footwear. His dream is for his children to one day take over the business and get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Juliana Dorotea

texts.en:
Juliana has been running her 'pulperia', the Nicaraguan equivalent to a corner store, for the last 12 years. She is requesting this loan to buy products to stock her store. Though she has had a 'pulperia' for years, the loans she has received from CEPRODEL have helped her expand the number and type of products she offers her customers. Now her 'pulpería' is well-stocked and she has a display case and a freezer.

Juliana has been working with CEPRODEL for 5 years now. This is her 29th loan. She originally started her 'pulpería', however, with a loan from a different micro-finance agency. Loans have helped her expand her business and offer better products, she said.

loans.use: To buy products to stock her store

loans.name: Fatima Argentina

texts.es: La señora Fátima Martínez de 42 años de edad, soltera, reside en Monte Cristi, tiene un hijo de 14 años y estudia su secundaria, su exposo le ayuda con los gastos del hijo, su negocio es una pulpería que desde hace siete años administra, cuando inicio lo hizo con fondos que su mama le dio para que se independizara y  pudiera salir adelante, para incrementar su inventario ya que vende una variedad de cuadernos, libros, cosméticos, bolsos, y una variedad de productos, con los préstamos que Afodenic a otorgado ha logrado surtir la librería en variedad ya que vende bastante por que da a buen precio a los estudiantes. Con este préstamo comprara cuadernos, lapiceros, bolso, y otros para surtir cada día su librería. A futuro es agrandar su negocio
texts.en:
Ms. Fátima Martínez is a 42-year-old single woman who lives in Monte Cristi. She has a 14-year-old son who is in high school. Her ex-husband helps out with their son’s expenses. She has been running her own general store for 7 years. She got her start thanks to the funds that her mother gave her so that she could become independent and get ahead. She wanted to increase her inventory because she sells a variety of books, notebooks, cosmetics, backpacks, and an assortment of other products. With the loans that she has received from Afodenic, she has been able to stock her book store with a variety of products, boosting her sales significantly because she offers students great prices. With this loan, she will purchase notebooks, pencils, backpacks, and other products to restock her bookstore every day. Her future plan is to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase notebooks, pencils, backpacks, etc.

loans.name: Joana

texts.en:
Joana is 37 years old, is married, and is the mother of three children. All her kids are in school.

Joana is a trader and trades in assorted staple goods such as grocery products, foodstuffs, plastic bowls, etc. She takes delivery of stock from Kumasi in the Ashanti region of Ghana and retails to her customers. She has been in business for five years now.

Joana requests the loan to increase her stock as we are approaching Christmas festivities. With the loan, she believes she can meet the demands of her customers, hence making more profits. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs like gari (roasted cassava), plantains, etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 43-year-old married woman with five children. Three of her children are in school while the rest are into trading.

Mary works hard to provide for her family. She trade her goods in the community market where she lives. She trades fresh vegetables like tomatoes, onions, pepper, etc., in bulk in the market. She takes delivery of goods from the surrounding villages and sometimes purchases stock from Kumasi central market.

Mary’s problem now has to do with adequate business funding to make progress. With the loan, she believes her dream of buying more stock can be achieved.

loans.use: To buy vegetables like onions, peppers, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Pastora Del C.

texts.en:
Pastora runs a small store, a “pulpería”, in the city of Chinandega. She is requesting a loan to buy products in bulk for her store. This will be much cheaper for her and will allow her to sell her products for less. 

Pastora’s pulpería has been open for 4 years and is located inside her house. "The loans help me a lot," she said. "They allow my business to keep growing." Pastora is single with several adult children.  Support from her children helped her open her store 4 years ago.

loans.use: To buy products in bulk for her store

loans.name: Roke M.

texts.en:
Roke M. K. is age thirty-five, is married to a businesswoman, and they have four children who are attending primary and secondary schools.

Roke is seeking a loan of SLL 1,000,000 to pay school fees for his children and to invest in his business. He has sold slippers and flip-flops and used clothes for over four years now.

loans.use: To pay school fees and to invest in his business

loans.name: Fuerza Y Union Hacia El Futuro Group

texts.es:
DELIA CELINDA R. S., es viuda,  hace poco tiempo perdió a su esposo, tiene 39 años D. edad y tiene 3 hijos D. 14, 10 y 2 años D. edad. Actualmente es L. Tesorera D. su Grupo denominado “Fuerza y unión hacia el Futuro” que cuenta con 10 integrantes.
L. Sra. Delia se dedica a L. venta D. comida, el cual funciona en un espacio D. su casa. ElL. se inició vendiendo gelatinas y chupetes, pudiendo reunir poco a poco un pequeño capital, el que le serviría para invertir en los menús que ofrecería al público.
Con L. pérdida D. su esposo, quien era su compañero y apoyo, se vio D. un momento a otro,  soL.. Al inicio fue muy duro y hasta estuvo a punto D. perder su negocio. Pero al ver que sus hijos L. necesitaban, toma valor y retoma el trabajo.
Actualmente, aparte D. su pequeño restaurant, iniciará su negocio D. venta D. productos D. limpieza, el cual espera le vaya bien.
Sin embargo, elL. siempre está pensando en el futuro D. sus hijos, trabajar mucho para poder darles una buena educación, es por eso que se ha planteado como una próxima meta invertir en L. venta D. jugos y yogurt, para lo cual ya se ha capacitado; y con su negocio actual empezará a juntar su capital.
texts.en:
Delia Celinda R. S. is a widow. She lost her husband only a short time ago. She is 39 years old and has three children of 14, 10 and 2 years of age. She is currently the treasurer of the group named “Fuerza y unión hacia el Futuro” (Strength and solidarity towards the future) which has ten members. Delia sells food from her home. She began by selling jellies and lollipops, and bit by bit she got a small capital together which she used to invest in set menus to offer to the public. The loss of her husband, her companion and support, saw her left alone from one moment to the next. At the beginning it was very hard and she was at the point of losing her business. But after seeing her children who needed her, she gathered her strength and took up her business again. Apart from her small restaurant, she is about to start up a business selling cleaning products, which she hopes will go well. However, she is always thinking about her children's future and she works hard to give them a good education. For this reason she has set her next goal to sell juices and yogurt which she has already completed training to do. With this initiative and with her current business she can begin to put together some capital.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products for her future juice store

loans.name: Dennys Maradiaga

texts.en:
Dennys sells fruit and vegetables to his customers. He is requesting a loan so he can buy vegetables for his store in bulk. Buying in bulk helps him save money and offer better prices to his customers. He started his vegetable business 6 years ago with a loan from a different micro-finance institution. His vegetables are displayed in baskets in the El Bisne Market in Chinandega.

"Receiving loans from CEPRODEL has helped me a lot," said Dennys. It helped him expand his business and now he is better able to handle requests for vegetables from restaurants. Dennys is 37 years old. He is married with 3 children. All three of his children are currently in school.

loans.use: To buy vegetables in  bulk

loans.name: Bilma Monserrate

texts.en:
Bilma Monserrate A. H. is 38 years old and lives in the Paraiso district of Guayaquil. Her days are spent supervising a general store far removed from the zone's main roads, while her husband tends to his construction job and her 5 children concentrate on school work. Their family home is under construction, so the store also doubles as Bilma's bedroom.  Always the optimist, Bilma says her current living arrangement allows her to sell eggs, bananas, cola, and cookies at a moment's notice.

She is requesting a loan to purchase marketable holiday merchandise such as Christmas decorations, toys and contemporary clothing.  In the future, she hopes to complete construction on their family home which is located closer to Paraiso's main roads.  She is grateful for any support we can provide her business so that her family may prosper!

loans.use: to buy holiday merchandise

loans.name: La Fuerza De Cristo 5&6 Group

texts.en:
Azulia is a 53-year-old borrower who lives near La Romana, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for the group La Fuerza de Cristo (The Strength of Christ), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in her group. 

The area surrounding La Romana is dominated by the vast sugar fields of the Dominican Republic. Electricity is scarce and there is no access to potable water. Despite the difficulties of living in this area, Azulia successfully runs a small business selling clothing and some other items. With this loan, Azulia will purchase new and used clothing, as well as bed sheets and sandals, to sell to her community.

This is Azulia’s third loan with Esperanza International, and with a perfect repayment record so far, she hopes it will not be her last. She came to Esperanza because the interest was lower than what she was able to find elsewhere, with no collateral. With the profits her loan brings, Azulia hopes to finish building her home. She also hopes to purchase a small van so that she will have transportation for both her business and her family. Thank you for lending to Azulia and the La Fuerza de Cristo group!

loans.use: Used & new clothing, sheets, & slippers.

loans.name: Eveling Del Carmen

texts.es: Eveling del Carmen  tiene 52 años, su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 8 años que inicio con esta actividad, Ella siempre ha sido una mujer luchadora y emprendedora. Por lo que tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000 y con la ayuda de los financiamientos es que ha logrado salir adelante. Actualmente solicita este financiamiento con el fin de invertir en nuevos productos que sus clientes más jóvenes solicitan. Su deseo es mejorar los ingresos para su familia y proporcionarle condiciones necesarias.
texts.en:
Eveling del Carmen is a 52-year-old woman who sells cosmetics for a living. She has been in business for over 8 years. She has always been a hard-working and enterprising woman. She has been working with Fundación León 2000 for a long time and has been able to get ahead with the help of microloans. She is currently requesting this loan in order to invest it in purchasing the new products that her younger customers are asking for. Her dream is to improve her income for the sake of her family, thus allowing her to provide them with the necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Yader Enrique

texts.es: El joven Yader Enrique Pérez V. , tiene la edad de 27 años , habita en Veracruz , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como operaria en zona Franca , ellos tienen un hijo actualmente estudia su primaria , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , don Yader desde hace varios años labora como chofer de transporte pesado y viaja a los diferentes departamentos, muchas veces peligrosa los viaje  por que las carreteras están en mal estado.  Agradece a Afodenic  por la buena aprobación de su primer crédito, ya que lo va invertir en materiales de construcción para terminar de hacer su casa y poder ofrecer a su familia una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Mr. Yader Enrique Pérez V. is a 27-year-old man who lives in Veracruz with his wife, who works in a factory in the Free-Trade Zone. They have a son who currently attends elementary school. His plan for his family is to improve their living conditions. Mr. P. has been working as a truck driver for several years. He travels throughout the various departments, often times on treacherous highways that are in disrepair. He gives tanks to Afodenic for approving his first loan because he is going to invest it in purchasing construction materials to finish building his house, thus allowing him to offer his family a decent dwelling.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase building materials: rocks, sand, cement, iron, etc.

loans.name: Madres Unidas 1&2 Group

texts.en:
Gloria is a 38-year-old borrower who lives near Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for the group Madres Unidas (Mothers United), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in her group. 

Specifically, Gloria lives the Los Alcarrizos region of Santo Domingo. This area is one of the most difficult places to live in the entire Dominican Republic. Electricity is scarce, shelter is insufficient, and there is no access to potable water. Despite the difficulties of living in this area, Gloria successfully runs a small natural pharmacy. In addition to this business, she also sells some clothing when sales are not going well in the pharmacy. 

This is Gloria’s very first loan with Esperanza International, and with a successful repayment, she hopes it will not be her last. She came to Esperanza so that her business could expand. She hopes that with the extra money, she can not only improve her business, but also save money for herself and her family.

loans.use: Natural medicines and some clothing.

loans.name: Liliam Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Liliam del Carmen R. U., tiene la edad de 30 años, habita en el barrio Denis Larios, ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe,  junto a su esposo, el cual trabaja como operario en Tip-Top, ellos tiene tres hijos a su cargo , todos estudiante de primaria , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y darle un buena educación a sus hijos , doña Liliam desde hace diez años , se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas ya que su abuelito le apoya con las tierras para que las cultive y las trabaje , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es el humo de cerros que en ocasiones afecta al cultivo , agradece a la institución por la buena aprobación de su séptimo crédito ya que ha mejorado las técnicas de producción y ha vendido a un buen precio los productos,  lo que le permite pagar en tiempo y forma sus desembolso. Con este préstamo comprara  insumos y venenos para aplicar al cultivo lo cual espera obtener una buena cosecha
texts.en:
Liliam del Carmen R. U., 30, lives in the Denis Larios neighborhood, which is located in the Ticuantepe municipality. She lives with her husband, who is a Tip-Top workman. They are raising three children, who are all in elementary school. The plans for the family are to improve their living conditions and give the children a good education. Liliam has been working in agriculture for ten years. Her grandfather supports her with some land to cultivate, and she works that land. The biggest difficulty is the smoke from the hills that occasionally affects the crops. She is grateful to the institution for the approval of her seventh loan. The technical part of production has improved, and she has sold her products for a good price. This allows her to pay on time and in good form. With this loan she will buy supplies and pesticide to apply to her crops in the hopes of getting a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies and pesticides to apply and improve her production

loans.name: Marling Ivania

texts.es: Marling Ivania tiene 34 años, es una mujer casada y junto a su pareja tiene 5 hijos todos estudian en colegios públicos. Su actividad económica es la venta y elaboración de pastes de baño. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este tipo de trabajo, por lo que sus hijos le ayudan en lo que pueden, porque ellos saben que es por medio de este trabajo que obtiene el sustento diario para la familia. Ella viaja a mangua para comprar ciertos accesorios que son necesarios para la elaboración de sus productos. Es por eso que solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de esponja, tela, hilo, tijeras, entre otras cosas. Su deseo es adquirir una maquina industrial, que le ayude a mejorar sus productos.
texts.en:
Marling Ivania is 34 years old and married. She and her husband have five children that all study at public schools. They make and sell bath scrubbers. They've been in this line of work for more than six years. Their children help them as they can because they understand that their family's daily needs are met through this work.

Marling Ivania travels to Mangua to buy certain accessories that are needed to make her products. She is requesting this funding in order to buy sponge, fabric, thread, scissors, and other products. Her desire is to buy an industrial sewing machine that will help her improve her products.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Morey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La señora Maria Elena C. C., tiene la edad de 57 años, habita en el barrio San Caralampio, ubicado en La Concepción Masaya, junto a su esposo, el cual trabaja como comerciante, para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen tres hijos, todos ya casado e independientes, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, ya que ella inicio los trabajos agrícolas con el apoyo de sus padres , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es que no tiene una camioneta propia para poder trasladar las frutas y en ocasiones las plagas han afectado el cultivos ya que carecen de insumos necesarios para ser una buena fruta  agradece a la institución por la buena aprobación de su primer crédito ya que lo va a invertir en insumos y fertilizantes y poder lograr una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Maria Elena C. C. is 57 years old and lives in the neighborhood of San Caralampio, located in La Concepción Masaya. She lives with her husband who works as a shopkeeper to support her with the household expenses. They have three children, all of whom are already married and independent. Her plans for her family are to improve their quality of life. Maria Elena began her farming work with the support of her parents. The biggest difficulties that she faces are that she does not have her own little truck to transport the fruits and that on occasion, pests have harmed the crops since they lack the supplies necessary to produce a good crop. She is grateful for the institution for the approval of her first loan, which she will invest in supplies and fertilizers so that she will be able to achieve a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizer to improve the harvest

loans.name: El Vallecito Group

texts.es:
PEDRO OMAR S. S.; tiene 36 años D. edad, es soltero. Actualmente desempeña el cargo D. Secretario D. su grupo D. nombre “El Vallecito”.
El Sr. Pedro, es una persona dedicada a servir a los demás, y preocupado por brindar apoyo a las familias D. preferencia D. bajos recursos, mediante el servicio D. capacitación en diversos temas como derechos D. las personas, maltratos físicos y psicológicos, etc.
Junto a  4 personas más promocionan sus talleres, que en muchos casos son gratuitos.
Gracias a esta labor, él nos manifiesta que se siente realizado como persona, pero le gustaría seguir apoyando a los demás, por lo que se ha planteado como próxima meta a lograr en unos seis meses, si todo sale bien, implementar un Centro D. Servicios y Apoyo, que esté ubicado en una zona D. bajos recursos, que presenten casos D. mujeres maltratadas para poder ofrecer ayuda legal y psicológica.
El préstamo solicitado los destinará a la compra D. 3 computadoras usadas, las cuales servirán para implementar con equipos su proyecto del Centro D. Servicios.
texts.en:
Pedro Omar S. Sanches, 36, is single. He currently performs the duties of secretary of the El Vallecito Group. Pedro is a person who is dedicated to serving others. He is very concerned about offering support through loan services to families with scant resources. He is also concerned about diverse themes like human rights and physical and psychological abuse, etc. Together with four other people they promote their shops, which is many cases is free. Thanks to this labor, he says that he feels fulfilled as a person. But, he does not want to keep supporting others. Therefore, he has established his next goal, which is to be met in six months. If all goes well, he will set up a Center for Services and Support. It will be located in an area with scant resources where there are cases of women being mistreated. He will do this in order to offer them legal and psychological support. The loan he is asking for is to buy three used computers. They will serve to implement his Service Center project.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy used computers

loans.name: Santusa

texts.en:
Santusa is a client of Asociación Arariwa. She is a member of a communal bank that consists of 15 neighbors who live in Ccorao, a town 30 minutes from Cusco, Peru.  The loan group is called Reynita de Belen de Ccorao and is named after a virgin of Peru. She is 33 years old and married. She has three children who are currently studying in school.

Santusa sells artisan products that she buys in Cusco. She sells approximately 200-300 soles worth of goods every month, which is equivalent to approximately $70-105. She will use this loan to buy more products to sell.

Santusa appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: Merchandise for her handicrafts store

loans.name: Porfirio Bonifacio

texts.es: El señor Porfirio Bonifacio Hernández, tiene la edad de 57 años , habita en el barrio Palestina , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa , la cual trabaja como comerciante para apoyarles con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen once hijos , cuatro hijos ya independiente y siete a su cargo ; todos estudiantes , en tiempos libres le apoyan con los trabajos agrícolas , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , ya que en un futuro quiere ampliar su vivienda , don Porfirio desde hace 40 años se dedica a  la agricultura ya que sus padres le apoyaron con las tierras y trabajaras para sus hijos , agradece a la institución por la buena aprobación de su cuarto crédito , el cual va invertirlo en insumos y fertilizantes para obtener una buena producción y pagar en tiempo y formas su prestamo.
texts.en:
Porfirio Bonifacio Hernández is 57 years old and lives in the neighbourhood of Palestina, located in the municipality of Ticuantepe. He lives with his wife who works as a shopkeeper to help them with home expenses. They have eleven children, four of whom are already independent and seven that they care for, all of whom study. In their free time they help him with agricultural chores. The family's plans are to improve their living conditions, as in the future they would like to extend their house. Mr. Porfirio has worked in agriculture for forty years, as his parents supported him with the land and jobs for his children. He thanks Kiva's partner institution for approving his fourth loan, which he will invest in supplies and fertilisers so he can obtain a good harvest and repay his loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilisers to apply to his crops

loans.name: Abdilia Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Abdilia del Carmen Hernández J., tiene la edad de 45 años, habita en el reparto Juan Ramón Padilla, junto a su esposo el cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen cinco hijos ya todos independientes, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y poder construir una caseta donde puede vender frutas y verduras, doña Abdilia desde hace quince años se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras , ella inicio esta actividad con el apoyo de su esposo , ella vende en el mercado de Masaya , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es el transporte para trasladar la venta , Agradece a Afodenic, por su buena aprobación de su onceavo crédito ya que son muchas las familias que se benefician y lograr mejor su condición de vida. Con este préstamo comprara frutas y verduras variadas para mejorar las ventas.
texts.en:
Abdilia del Carmen Hernández J., 45, lives in the Juan Ramó Padilla division with her husband. He works and helps with the household expenses. They have five children, who are now independent. The family plans are to improve their living conditions and be able to build a stall where she can sell fruits and vegetables. Abdilia has been selling fruits and vegetables for 15 years. She started this activity with help from her husband. She sells in the Masaya market. The biggest difficulty she has is transporting the products to sell. She is grateful to Afodenic for the approval of her eleventh loan. There are many families who benefit and achieve better living conditions. She will use this loan to buy various fruits and vegetables to improve her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruits and vegetables to increase sales

loans.name: Ener Eliu

texts.es: El Joven  Ener Eliu Sánchez, tiene la edad de 24 años, habita en Veracruz, junto a sus padres, el es soltero, desde hace cinco años trabaja como guarda de seguridad, en una casa privada del mismo sector donde habita, los planes hacia su familia es poder terminar de construir su vivienda, agradece a Afodenic , por el apoyo que le ha brindado ya que con este segundo préstamo va a comprar materiales de construcción y poder hacer parte de la vivienda , a la vez esta contento ya que son muchas las familias que logran mejorar las condiciones de vida con estos programas internacionales  así como kiva. En un futuro espera tener su propia familia y seguir mejorando su casa ya que va parte por parte para poder cubrir la cuota y otras necesidades personales.
texts.en:
Ener Eliu Sánchez is a young man who is 24 years old and single. He lives with his parents and works as a security guard at a private home located in the same district. Thanks to the loans AFODENIC has provided, he can finish the construction of his house. This will be the second loan he receives and will use it to purchase building materials.

Ener is very happy that there are families who are able to improve their living conditions through international programs like Kiva. In the future, he expects to have his own family and continue improving his home since they go hand in hand. His is able to cover his loan payments and his other personal necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase building materials such as stone, cement, sand, etc.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es: Doña Justima vive en la zona D. Kamirpata, aproximadamente a 10 Km. del centro D. ciudad, en domicilio propio tiene 64 años D. edad, es viuda, vive actualemte con una D. sus hijas, su actividad principal es la venta D. pescado , el mismo que lo realiza en su puesto ubicado en la parada del micro 155, en el barrio D. Achachicala, todos los dias D. la semana excepto los viernes y sabado que viaja a Taypiplaya, al norte del departamento D. La Paz, en nor yungas, a vender pescado con cerca D. un capital D. $us 400.-.El crédito solicitado está dirigido a la compra D. un refrigerador para la tienda D. Taypiplaya y mercaderia para surtir la tienda."
texts.en:
Doña Justina is 64 years old, widowed, and currently lives with one of her daughters. She sells fish locally every day of the week except Fridays and Saturdays, when she travels to sell at another location. When she travels, she takes inventory with her valued around $400 USD. She is requesting a loan to purchase a refrigerator to keep at her main location for storing fish for when she travels.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a refrigerator for storing fish

loans.name: Juana Rosa

texts.es: La señora Juana Rosa M. H., tiene la edad de 49 años, habita en La Concepción, junto su esposo el cual es responsable de una iglesia cristiana y recibe ayuda de la misma , lo cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar , doña Juana desde hace quince años se dedica al comercio , pero las ganancias no le permite comprar de una solo vez materiales de construcción , agradece a la institución por su buena aprobación de su primer crédito , a la vez esta contenta por la confianza y los intereses bajos los cuales benefician a todas las familias logrando una mejor comodidad y seguridad para su familia. con este crédito comprara piedra, arena, cemento, hierro y comenzar hacer las mejoras de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana Rosa M. H. is 49 years old and lives in La Concepción. Her husband is in charge of a Christian church. They also receive support from the church to cover their household expenses. Doña Juana has been a merchant for 15 years, but her earnings are not enough to cover a one-time purchase of construction materials. She thanks the Institution for approving her first loan. Doña Juana is happy they have confidence in her and for providing low interest rates that benefit all families. She will be able to provide more comfortable and secure conditions for her family. The loan will be used to buy stone, sand, cement, and iron so that she can begin making improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase building materials such as stone, sand, cement, and iron
